sequence: Big Data is transforming the way Canadian businesses are able to build meaningful relationships with their customers. Today the Chief Information Officer and Chief Marketing Officer must combine efforts for true competitive advantage. A new market research report called "1 + 1 = 3: CMO & CIO Collaboration Best Practices That Drive Growth" looks at the new realities that are changing traditional roles of marketing and information technology. This report addresses how organizations are aligning their efforts to better understand and interact digitally with their customers and drive loyalty. According to studies by the Conference Board of Canada, Canadian organizations appear to be lagging behind the consumers.

GoldMoney founder James Turk interviews When Money Dies author Adam Fergusson, who discusses the parallels and differences between the Weimar inflation and the situation in the US and Europe today. "I don't see how any of these [Western] economies can grow their way out of the extraordinary debts that they have." At the recent Casey/Sprott Summit When Money Dies, nearly 30 renowned financial experts – such as John Hathaway, Richard L. Hanley, Chris Martenson, Mike Maloney, Rick Rule, Doug Casey, and many more – presented their assessments of the ongoing global debt crisis and solutions for smart investors.

Salad may be an overlooked part of the holiday meal, but it doesn’t have to be that way, thanks to this beautiful salad that’s robust enough to stand up to the rest of the meal. Wrap each beet in foil and set on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast for 50 to 60 minutes, or until tender when pierced with a paring knife. Set aside to cool for 15 minutes. While the beets cool, increase the oven to broil. Arrange the citrus segments in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet, then sprinkle with the brown sugar.

(Reuters) - For U.S. media companies and investors, it was the ruling of the decade. A federal judge in Washington had sole power to decide whether telecoms company AT&T Inc could buy Time Warner Inc, the parent of HBO, CNN and Warner Bros, for $85 billion and reshape the U.S. media landscape. After a six-week long trial, Judge Richard Leon set a hearing date of June 12 at 4 p.m. (2000 GMT) to announce his ruling. People were so keen to get a seat in his courtroom that they took turns standing in line more than 24 hours ahead of the event.

You have to give Square Enix points for honesty; Bravely Default: For the Sequel wears its primary intentions right on its sleeve. I mean, it's right in the title: "For the Sequel." The new updated version of the original Bravely Default: Flying Fairy is currently being developed in parallel to the game's upcoming as-of-yet untitled sequel. However, unlike your standard updated rerelease of a game, Square Enix is looking to use For the Sequel as a testing bed for the sequel (Christ, how many times am I going to have to use that term.).

Do n't miss this charming 3 bed , 2 bath home on a near 1/4 acre lot in the center of town! Open concept with an open kitchen area, separate eating area, dining room, laundry room and plenty of storage! A second room has a king bed, and has an open shower. The kitchen has a full size refrigerator, stove top with oven, microwave and coffee maker, toaster, coffee pot and blender, refrigerator/ freezer, and all you really need are dishes, glasses, dishes, and silverware. The second bath has a double sink and is large and private!

If you are a soda drinker unable to decide between healthier homemade sodas and your favorite off-the-shelf Coke , the answer is no. There is no single best sodas for soda drinkers all over the world. Most soda drinkers will need a combination of two or more brands in order to find the right one. But in order to help you narrow the choices, we have found the best soda blends for soda drinkers to choose from, and have made this article as simple as possible. There are two different types of soda bottles: the glass bottle with an aluminum can at the center, as well as the plastic bottle.

The ex-girlfriend of the football star whose plane disappeared has spoken out — making a sensational claim about who is to blame for her disappearance — while denying that she saw her boyfriend as she was trying to get him to leave her flat. She also claims that she and her boyfriend were together the whole time she was in the flat, and that she doesn’t even know where he is. The ex-girlfriend of football star Emile Heskey is claiming that she saw him on the phone with his wife while she was doing her shopping on Christmas day.

Born in the country and fluent in the language, Gursewak Singh considers himself Japanese. The government doesn't. But it sometimes offers children like him a chance to stay - if their parents agree to leave. MATSUDO, Japan – Gursewak Singh composed his first letter to Japan’s justice minister when he was 10 years old. Almost seven years later, he is still writing. In all, he has written more than 50 letters. He has yet to get a reply. The letters, all written in Japanese, have become more eloquent as Gursewak has grown up.

Millions of refugees have fled their homes in war-torn Syria since 2011 . President Barack Obama previously planned to resettle up to 100,000 people from the region, but the administration has not announced any specific dates for the new programs. Many of those coming to the U.S. have left behind children, parents and extended family members. As of Thursday, the United Nations reported a total of 6,976 people were in the U.S. , and another 3,890 were on their way. Most were from Syria and Iraq, where fighting between government forces and armed opposition groups continues.

Best Buy Co. Inc. shares surged 9% in premarket trade after the electronics retailer's fiscal third-quarter profit and revenue sailed past estimates. Best Buy said it had net income of $107 million, or 30 cents a share, in the quarter, up from $54 million, or 12 cents a share, in the year-earlier period. Adjusted per-share earnings came to 32 cents, well ahead of the 25 cents estimate from analysts polled by FactSet. Revenue rose to $9.38 billion from $9.33 billion, also ahead of the FactSet estimate of $9.11 billion.

( Reuters ) - British serviced office space provider IWG Plc said on Wednesday it would close or refurbish some 50,000 to 60,000 of its UK office units due to falling demand. The U.S. company, a unit of UBS, said it expected the number of offices it was providing across Europe to fall by 20 percent this year. IWG is also closing or moving out some 70,000 to 80,000 UK staff. The U.S. bank’s IWG brand is used for office space in the United States, the United Arab Emirates, the United States, Germany and the UK.

Keep it classy . Cheer . Revel in a rival . And Yankees - keep it brief , a simple tribute to the most beloved team in sports . It's the one thing about this team that's always been able to pull together and come up with great results , and this tribute is the perfect way to honor those great moments . . . and it also has some pretty funny moments in it as well . I know it's not a typical tribute, but I thought I would put it here for people to check out.

Holwell Sports reached their first Senior County Cup final in 17 years on Tuesday evening after a penalty shoot-out win against fellow Premier League side Arsenal. The game was refereed by Mike Jones, who also took charge in the 2002 final and the 2009 final. The match was the first senior match for both teams. Former England and Arsenal captain Gary Speed, who scored the winning penalty, was the hero of the game, with goals from Joe Allen, Phil Parkinson and Paul Merson adding to the Arsenal side's early dominance before the half-time lead was broken.

Former police officer Drew Peterson threw his wife to the floor one night, grabbed her throat and told her he "could kill her there and then," a one-time co-worker of the wife testified Tuesday at a hearing to determine what evidence can be admitted in Peterson's murder trial. Kathleen Savio, Drew Peterson's third wife, who mysteriously drowned in a bathtub six years ago, essentially is testifying from the grave during the hearing. Witnesses are expected to tell a judge how Savio discussed and wrote about her fears that Peterson, a former Bolingbrook police sergeant, would kill her.

No doubt if you are into painting of the artistic kind then you will probably know that artist Thomas Kinkade is an internationally renowned artist. Kinkade, who hails from the USA, has gained considerable recognition as a painter and an impressionist. He started his art career in Chicago, IL and has been living in Los Angeles USA for some time now. Thomas Kinkade is a prolific artist whose paintings have appeared all over the world. His name and works can be considered as art works. He has received numerous awards for his body of work and is also known for his portrait paintings.

Unum Therapeutics Inc. is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company . The Company is focused on the developing and commercializing of novel therapeutics for treating difficult-to-treat diseases including rare disorders and serious infections. Its lead product, UNOCHT-F, is an antibody designed to neutralize human and animal anti-FUT8 antibody, which is a known inhibitor of viral entry and replication. This product will be commercialized in a phase 3 program. Unum Therapeutics Inc. is currently seeking to raise up to $7.5 million in Series A, B, C and D financings, including a $5.2 million term loan facility under the company’s $7.2 billion Series D and DVI financings.

Williams is described as a 5-foot-9, 140-pound black female. She has black hair and brown eyes as well a tattoo on her upper arm that says "Denise." ASHEVILLE — Asheville police are requesting public assistance to find a woman wanted on six open warrants including trafficking drugs and larceny. The department said Monday it is searching for Denise Nicole Williams. Williams, 26, has outstanding warrants for larceny, failure to return rental property, trafficking opium or heroin, two counts of possession with intent to manufacture, sell or distribute a Schedule II controlled substance and possession of drug paraphernalia.

HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) — Pennsylvania State Police say car accidents killed seven people and injured 315 others over the long holiday weekend. From Dec. 21 through Christmas, state police investigated 1,336 crashes. Of those, 108 were alcohol-related. Two of the seven people who died were not wearing seat belts. One fatality stemmed from an alcohol-related accident. Troopers made 348 arrests for driving under the influence and issued 2,152 speeding citations. Crash and casualty numbers are up from 2011, but the holiday weekend was longer this year. In 2011, authorities reported five people died and 169 others were hurt in 509 crashes.

Abby Kelley has 1,426 students in kindergarten through high school this year and is at maximum enrollment . A new math and English teacher are scheduled to start at the school this fall and a new high school counselor is scheduled to begin in mid-April. "We don't want to have to turn away anyone for the first couple of years because it's going to add to the costs. We want it to be affordable," Kelley said. A new principal has been chosen to work with the current principal, who has been with the school for four years, she said.

Doing business in British Columbia is particularly challenging because of the province’s reputation as a hotbed of environmental and aboriginal activism. John Winter worries it could get worse, threatening $90-billion in planned projects, if the Northern Gateway oil pipeline isn’t built. “If this thing fails it will be a serious and significant issue,” Mr. Winter, president and CEO of the B.C. Chamber of Commerce, which represents 125 chambers around the province with 36,000 businesses in every sector of the economy, said in an interview.

The pheasant-hunting season in New York is under way, and thanks to a great stocking program hunters should find plenty of action. New York’s DEC says it has released close to 25,000 adult pheasants on lands open to public hunting. The pheasant season began Oct. 1 in northern and eastern portions of the state, and will open on Saturday in central and western parts and Nov. 1 on Long Island. Pheasants are raised at the DEC’s Reynolds Game Farm in Ithaca. The majority of the birds will be released on state wildlife-management areas and cooperative hunting areas prior to and during the fall hunting season.

In Syria , Peace Plan 'Is Unraveling ' : The Two-Way `` It 's almost as if in certain parts of Syria , peace plans are unraveling. Bashar Assad , in power since 2000, is trying to end the civil war that has killed more than 300,000 and left more than two million homeless -- by the end of 2013 the country will have a bigger refugee problem than in all of the Arab world combined, the UN High Commissioner for Refugees has said. "The situation on the ground is rapidly getting worse. People are not safe.

In Atlanta This Weekend? Then You Should Be At Momocon. Anime and gaming convention Momocon is on day three of it’s newly extended four-day run, which leaves plenty of time to check out some cosplay, buy some vintage video games and maybe watch a Kotaku writer judge an indie game contest. When I first attended Momocon back in 2010, it was an incredibly small convention held on the campus of Georgia Tech. Now it’s a massive event spanning multiple locations—the Omni Hotel, the Georgia World Congress Center, the Georgia World Congress Center’s tiny bathrooms—with more than 20,00o people expected to attend.

The word hero gets thrown around so much that its use has lost much of the intended impact. Indie filmmaker Denise Ohio restores a bit of the word’s luster with this surprisingly compelling portrait of Frank Minden. Who? An ordinary, hard-working man, a WWII vet and master diesel machinist, the 76-year-old Minden has never signed a multimillion-dollar contract with a sports franchise or refused an Oscar in honor of the worthy cause of the day. But in the short space of thirty minutes, Ohio illustrates what makes this St. Louis man so admired and respected by those around him.

BANGKOK (Reuters) - The leader of Thailand’s military junta said on Thursday that Yingluck Shinawatra, the prime minister he ousted three years ago, was in Dubai, where she fled last month to avoid being jailed over a rice subsidy scheme that lost billions of dollars. Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha, the army chief who led the coup, said Thailand would pursue Yingluck through diplomatic channels and police cooperation using Interpol. His remarks came a day after the country’s top court found Yingluck guilty of criminal negligence and sentenced her in absentia to five years in prison.

COLOGNE CATHEDRAL SWITCHED off its light last night , in protest at the weekly anti-Islam rallies happening in Dresden . Organised by the Pegida movement , the marches have been seen around the world in countries as disparate as North Africa, Europe , India and Russia. Last night's rally in Dresden was held outside the Church of Saint Mary, a church which has had a long and often controversial history with Islamists. Organisers said the church had refused to turn off its lights and the event had been disrupted by police who forced their way in to stop the march.

WASHINGTON – Congress is moving to put under military control all armed contractors operating in combat zones, a Pentagon recommendation that could run into resistance at the State Department. The Senate this month included such a requirement in its 2008 defense spending bill. Democratic Sen. Carl Levin, chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, told reporters Wednesday he is confident the House will go along with the idea and include it in a final bill sent to President George W. Bush. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice was to testify about the subject Thursday before the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee.

The PS4 is launching with a versatile set of games today, but that doesn’t mean Sony wants gamers to focus on them. Mere minutes before the console’s launch, Sony took to a stage in New York City to reveal more exclusive experiences for its gaming console. The company started its launch event with news for fans of the The Last of Us adventure game starring Ellen Page. Sony’s studios are already working on a single-player campaign add-on for the game, and if the trailer is any indication, there are still more battles to fight and more mysteries to uncover.

The OLCC is cracking down on marijuana retailers that sell to minors. PORTLAND, Ore. – A rule increasing penalties for marijuana retailers that sell marijuana to minors takes effect Friday. The new rule allows a marijuana worker’s permit to be revoked if the person intentionally sells marijuana to a minor. It increases the penalty for the unintentional sale of marijuana to a minor to a 30-day license suspension or a $4,950 fine. Previously the penalty was a 10-day license suspension or a $1,650 fine. The Oregon Liquor Control Commission re-evaluated penalties after reviewing compliance from recent sting operations.

OAKLAND — Nine people living in East Oakland discovered over the past nine months what it”s like to be a journalist — taking on the challenge of telling important but unheard stories from the community around them. Saturday, those nine budding journalists graduated from the Oakland Voices nonprofit program, which helped give them the tools to gather and report those stories. Oakland Voices is a project founded by Oakland Tribune senior community engagement editor Martin Reynolds and coordinated by veteran journalist Brenda Payton. By enlisting people from Oakland”s neighborhoods to tell Oakland stories, the project unravels tales of tragedy and triumph that are not covered by mainstream media.

The halter neckline showed off her sculpted shoulders, while the sequins on the garment added a touch of sparkle. Jordin added a pop of color to the outfit with a bright orange clutch. Although the black and orange color combo could have looked a little Halloween, the subtle accessory was just enough to add a zing without looking too costumey. See the singer's leggy LBD look in the photos below! Jordin looks so fierce!

Jesse Winker will undergo season-ending shoulder surgery . He was batting .299 this year with 7 homers and 43 RBIs after being acquired from the White Sox in a four-player deal on Feb. 1. Winker is set to miss at least the rest of the season. It is expected he will be on a rehabilitation assignment before he's ready to return. "We don't know yet whether he'll be able to start next season, but I don't think we need to worry about that," manager Ron Washington said after Tuesday's game at Chicago.

Harvest season is back, which means it’s time to drive out to the farm stands on the East End of Long Island, but which ones are worth the trip is the question. Press readers voted Briermere Farms Best Farm Stand on Long Island in the 2017 Best of Long Island competition—a title this farm stand has earned for eight years in a row, thanks to their delicious, fresh, local produce. It’s no surprise that Briermere Farms took the top spot once again. Going to Briermere Farms is kind of like going home.

Police In London Investigate Attack On Pedestrians As Terrorism David Greene talks to Omer El-Hamdoon, president of the Muslim Association of Britain about the attack on pedestrians outside a mosque in north London early Monday. David Greene talks to Omer El-Hamdoon, president of the Muslim Association of Britain about the attack on pedestrians outside a mosque in north London early Monday. As we've been reporting, early this morning, a van plowed into pedestrians in London in what police are investigating as a terror attack. The driver of the van is in custody. One person died at the scene.

For decades , aid groups have assumed they know what 's best for refugees and the poor ; a growing number of them have even gone on to provide them with services that, in some cases, have turned their work into a political agenda. As a result, many refugees are being left with less than a chance of getting decent jobs, housing, education, health care, or even basic social services. A report by the Center for Immigration Studies , a pro-immigration-rights group that focuses on legal issues, finds that more than 40 percent of these refugees receive no financial assistance from their governments.

“ Overwatch ” was pristine out of the box . The character and level design were excellent . It combined to create a very fun experience, but at the same time something that you just had to play. The game was an instant winner for me. I was hooked right from the start. If you were wondering, I don’t play the game , so I have no idea what to expect from it, but I am hoping the game is worth getting. It might be a bit pricey for me, so I hope it works out for them.

•Maranda M. Stroman , 40 , of Herrick Street in Elmira , was indicted by a Chemung County grand jury on July 2, 2009, for operating a vehicle while intoxicated in the presence of a child under the age of fifteen (15). She pleaded not guilty during a preliminary examination held before Judge William F. Ryan on July 11, 2009, and was bound over to the Chemung County District Court on a $50,000 cash only bond. Prior to her appearance before the district court, she appeared before the magistrate judge and waived her right to counsel.

Eighteen years ago Monday, on June 24, 1995, South Africa’s Springbok rugby team staged a stunning upset to win the Rugby World Cup against the heavily favored New Zealand. But the game was much more than just one day’s win. This was the day Nelson Mandela cemented himself as leader of all South Africans. Elected the year before, democracy was still fragile and the racial divide was still raw. Rugby was an all-white game and Springbok captain Francois Pienaar was its hero. But Mandela enlisted Pienaar’s helps to use this final to unite, instead of divide.

New Jersey hits day three of its government shutdown Monday over a budget stalemate that's closed state parks — and will likely force the furlough of 35,000 workers. On Sunday, the impasse even inconvenienced Gov. Chris Christie, forcing him to leave a state beach that was on shutdown to the public — but open to his family — because he had to return to Trenton. All nonessential services remained closed as the Republican governor and the Democratic Assembly speaker continued to disagree over Christie's plan for a nonprofit health system that is at the center of the budget dispute.

He ’ s eaten dog food and appeared nearly naked on telly , but comedian Alex Horne has revealed his secret to weight loss . While he is clearly not a vegetarian he reveals he has tried many diets - and has always managed to drop a couple of stone with each - with one in particular helping him to shed his unwanted weight . But even though he's now in his mid forties he admitted to losing a lot of weight in the past two years . "I went on a low fat diet for about six months, and it did me in, especially my mid section," he told the BBC .

Banking giant Standard Chartered on Tuesday announced a return of dividends for shareholders after a two-year hiatus as it reported a 7.6% increase in profit for the third quarter ended in June. A year earlier, Standard Chartered announced that it would return its first dividend, which it paid to shareholders in November 2015, raising $11.3 billion. It would not issue a dividend to shareholders in the first quarter of 2019. Standard Chartered said it expects that the return of the dividend will help improve its profitability, especially in the fourth quarter when it plans to add 1,500 jobs.

The Defense Information Systems Agency has provided and operated telecommunications and information technology for decades . Today the Agency is engaged in a process of modernization and reorganization. As a result, the Defense Information and Communications Technology Agency is transitioning to a new business structure and a new structure has emerged within the agency as a result of that transformation. One new initiative in the current business model is the Defense Communications Support Office, which is a special program within the agency, under which the Defense Communications Support Office provides and operates the communications infrastructure used by the Department of Defense for military communications operations.

The analysis performed by the team’s members, some of whom acted as observers during 2013 local elections in Estonia, revealed that sophisticated attackers, like those employed by nation states, could easily compromise the integrity of the country’s Internet voting system and influence the election outcome, often without a trace. The team chose to analyze the Estonian system because Estonia has one of the highest rates of Internet voting participation in the world—over 21 percent of the total number of votes during the last local election were cast through the electronic voting system.

New Jersey hits day three of its government shutdown Monday over a budget stalemate that 's closed state parks — and left local officials scrambling to help families of state workers whose salaries are funded by a state pension fund. New Jersey Governor Chris Christie's office announced that the state's parks and historic sites would be closed beginning Tuesday due to "continuing uncertainty around state operations," according to a press release Monday. The closures will affect more than two dozen state agencies, including the state Department of Corrections and the Department of Environmental Protection.

Certainly one of the most brilliant dialogues in the ballet is its pas de deux. It was danced excellently and very dif ferently by twirl casts last week end in the New York City Bal let's current season at the State Theater. Sunday night marked the welcome return, after almost year's absence, of Arthur Mit dell. Matching the crystalline purity of Kay Mazzo, Mr. Mit 001 swung into his original sole with admirable flow and brio. By contrast, the catlike stealth of Jean‐Pierre Bonne fous in his local debut in the role gave it a note of emotion ally colored caution.

The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India ( Irdai ) has proposed to ask some insurance companies to mandatorily carry certain insurance policies. These policies include life insurance and auto accident insurance. These policies will also be compulsory in the next four years. In the last few years, these mandatory insurance policies had been rolled out in several States of India including Punjab, Telengana, Haryana, West Bengal, Himachal Pradesh and Kerala. According to the report, most of these mandatory insurance policies are mandatory for drivers and employees. These policies cover accidents, health care, disability and life events.

Todd P, one of the city's top local independent music promoters, helped open up a new venue last night in Bushwick/East Williamsburg, aka East Williamsburg Industrial Park. It's called Danbro Studios Warehouse, and it's home is in a mid-1800s raw warehouse, previously home to the Goldenrod Brewery, a 1930's-era beer manufacturer long shuddered, a victim of prohibition. The venue's first show featured popular Minneapolis punk rock band Dillinger 4 (bio) as they celebrated the release of Civil War, their first LP since 2002's Situationist Comedy.

EVE Online’s new “Abyssal Deadspace” areas let players engage in true one-on-one combat for big rewards. Just pray you don’t run into BoRn2ReIgN. Abyssal Deadspace pockets, introduced in the latest EVE expansion Onslaught, are a new way for players to engage in high-stakes combat. At the end of the hazard-filled Abyssal Deadspace pockets, new stargates beckon players into Abyssal arenas. In the heart of these arenas, rare and valuable loot is held in a secure container. The only thing stopping a player from scooping it into their cargohold and making a clean escape is another player angling for the same target.

Kids and computers can be a beautiful mix or a disaster waiting to happen. Education-based applications and popular games are some of the biggest reasons kids get on the computer, and the various dangers of the Internet are one of the biggest reasons parents shy away from granting free-reign access. Such is where the MiiPC comes in. This small desktop PC, which is a cube scarcely larger than a softball, is aimed at families with young children, and offers, among other things, parental controls and runs on Android Jelly Bean. Read our full SlashGear review to find out what all the MiiPC has to offer.

From Madonna to Sam Smith, Taylor posed with everyone! As was made evident in Taylor Swift's intro to the Best New Artist award at the Grammys, Taylor has a lot of friends. But you don't need me -- or Taylor -- to tell you. Tay is buds with everyone from rappers to Victoria's Secret Angels and has the Instagrams to prove it. With photographers aplenty at the Grammys on Sunday night, Tay didn't need a selfie stick for all the pics taken with her friends. Taylor -- a master mingler -- was snapped with everyone from Madonna to pal Sam Smith.

I was delighted to read in Eureka Street Ruby Hamad’s passionate protest that she and other Muslims should not constantly be called to account for the vicious behaviour of IS. Still less to be stigmatised until unnamed Muslim leaders disowned it. I was disconcerted to see so many Eureka Street readers appeared to agree with the demands against which she protested. Both Ruby’s complaint and the responses to it reminded me of the attitudes taken to Catholics in an earlier generation. The popular charges against Catholics were honed in the Great War and particularly by the referenda on Conscription.

One minute he was strutting around the end zone , staring into the stands , the look of a stone-cold killer. Ten seconds into a touchdown pass to a wide open Richard Rodgers, he was flat on the ground . He had to be carried to the sideline , head first , and the crowd went wild . Ten seconds. That’s it , that’s all it takes. He’s done. It’s over . He’ll be gone from this world. That’s how it feels . That’s what we’ve all been feeling .

May 23 - Egyptians arrive early at voting booth to cast their vote for the first president since deposed leader Morsi. June 11, 2013 (AFP) - Some 20,000 polling stations across Egypt are expected to close across the country, with voting continuing today in the first nationwide election to choose a new president after Mohamed Morsi was deposed earlier this month. At the beginning of voting on Thursday evening, some of the first voters were already queued outside some polling stations, waiting in the early hours of Tuesday for a ballot to be put into the ballot box and for the process of counting to be taken up.

Two capitals are look set to burst through the 40C mark and another swelters through its 10th day of a brutal cold snap on Sunday. On Tuesday, the Met Office has issued a heatwave warning in England and Wales, but as the mercury climbs towards 30C, those warnings are unlikely to have much of an impact. By contrast, it has been the UK's worst cold snap on record and one that has left the capital exposed for the first time in more than 10 years – as temperatures in some places hit 30C.

Iqbal Survé’s Sagarmatha Technologies, which failed to list on the JSE a year ago, has set its sights on an offshore listing, according to Survé’s newspaper Business Report. Sagarmatha, a technology company within the Sekunjalo investment group, has already made an application to the SA Reserve Bank, the publication said, citing Survé, the chair of Independent Media. In early 2018, Sagarmatha’s listing on the JSE — along with a mooted listing in New York — was scuppered by its failure to submit financial statements on time.

( CNN ) — Spending the night at an airport is n't usually an aspirational sleeping arrangement . That was not the case on a recent Friday evening in New York's Times Square, when CNN's Anderson Cooper and I arrived in the city from London just before midnight. Cooper ( left ) and I had been traveling together for three years on assignment. It felt like a vacation. As we waited outside a New York City nightclub, we took our places in the front row. We had just spent the evening in front of a restaurant that has since shut down.

Facing a mountain of debt and increased competition from online (Amazon) and brick-and-mortar (Wal-Mart) retailers, Toys R Us may be positioning itself for a possible bankruptcy filing, according to CNBC. A new report says the giant toy chain has hired a law firm to help restructure its roughly $400 million in debt. Toys R Us relies heavily on holiday sales to support year-round business, and 2016 proved to be a disappointment for the Wayne, N.J.-based company, and CNBC said those weaknesses carried into the spring with a net loss of $164 million in the first quarter of 2017.

The right sheet set and pajamas can help you stay cool. Today’s memory-foam mattresses don't sleep as "hot" as older models did, thanks to air-circulating layers and ventilated toppers that keep the foam from absorbing and retaining all your body heat. But a certain insulating effect is unavoidable when you're sleeping on a foam block. If your memory foam mattress leaves you sweating at night, a few remedies can help turn down the heat -- if only by a few degrees. Anything you can do to distance your body from the memory foam will help keep you cool.

We deliver person-centred services, encouraging individuals to live as independently as possible within their home and community. WASHINGTON — Thousands of commuters across the region were delayed Thursday morning by an apparent work action by Metro ’s bus system, even as the transit agency continues to battle what officials describe as the largest infrastructure project in decades. About 11 a.m., a commuter on a weekday morning bus service between the airport and downtown was forced to walk from the parking garage to the subway station for the 5 p.m. to midnight trip. The same commuter was forced to walk several times before he finally arrived at the station, a little more than eight minutes later, Metro spokeswoman Lauren Hitt told a reporter in a news conference Thursday morning.

ASTANA, Kazakhstan—Nursultan Nazarbayev, Kazakhstan’s first and only president, resigned on Tuesday, ending his nearly 30-year reign and setting the stage for an opaque succession process in the oil-rich Central Asian country of 18 million people. As his speech hinted, Nazarbayev’s departure from office will not mean giving up the reins of power. The aging leader, who has led Kazakhstan since 1989, when it was still part of the Soviet Union, said that Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, the speaker of the Senate and a trusted political ally of Nazarbayev, will take over as acting president until new elections are held in 2020.

Where will he wake up next? A prison cell? A tropical hammock? Or suspended on a cliff? It has the makings of a pretty good TV show, in the vein of Quantum Leap. Each day, a man wakes up to find himself in a different bed in a different part of the world. The experience, while clearly always disorienting, can vary dramatically based on the circumstances. Some days he’s in prison, or squatting in a storage bin. Other mornings he wakes up in a goat pen or a tropical hammock.

A shopping bonanza has hit Bawadi Mall , and will continue until May 1 , as part of Retail Abu Dhabi , the country’s largest shopping mall development. This year, Abu Dhabi is expected to break the records for the highest amount spent in the mall. A total of 13 million guests visited the mall in 2017, and plans are being prepared to host an even more crowded 2018, which is scheduled to open on October 3. According to the UAE’s Economic Development Department, more than 2 million people visited the mall last year, with the average spend being more than Dh1,5 million.

Most people have heard of Scrooge, even if they have never read A Christmas Carol or any other work of Charles Dickens, writes Adrian Hattrell. What is certain is that they have never experienced the story in the form of a folk opera, which is what was presented to Tickhill Music Society by the group calling itself Green Matthews and Guest – which comprised of Chris Green, Sophie Matthews and Jude Rees. The players set the scene with a medley of Victorian carols, music hall songs and folk songs, accompanying themselves on an astonishing range of period instruments, which were variously blown, plucked and squeezed.

A new study for The New York Times reveals that the media pay for the top 200 CEOs is now $14.5 million. This is up 55 in the last year. While any one CEO may be well worth his/her raise, it is a growing political and PR problem for corporate America to be seen as rewarding those at the top, with little consideration for actual performance. For millions of Americans who are unemployed, under employed and being foreclosed on, it seems inconceivable that corporate CEOs can be getting significant raises at a time of such economic hardship.

It takes a community to help migrant workers who need affordable medical care and social assistance . The theme of this event was, “Workers on the Job: Workers on the Job!” The theme is inspired by the motto, “All work and no pay makes the world go round,” and the fact that workers across the world are increasingly demanding the rights and protections of their rights as workers.

A Dallas County jury found Jesus Trevino , 33 , guilty of capital murder Monday in the death of 37-year-old Jesus Gaviria Jr. According to the court, the jury unanimously agreed that the murder of Gaviria was "premeditated" and "willfully, deliberately, and premeditatively planned," with the killing being carried out "to cover up a murder committed by Trevino." The jury found that Trevino's actions during the killing "warranted the same level of aggravating circumstances as if the defendant had been convicted of capital murder." Trevino was originally tried and convicted of capital murder by a Dallas County grand jury.

The Australian telecommunications (telco) industry is largely responsible for the highly connected and digital world we live in today. Their networks and services have fostered professional work environments and have brought together family and friends amidst Australia’s vast distances, and remote global position. But to continue doing so at an ever-changing pace, telco providers must accelerate their digital revolution. In fact Accenture, in collaboration with the World Economic Forum, has estimated that digitalisation could contribute approximately $100 trillion in value to the telecommunications industry over the next decade globally. Australian telecommunications operators have long maintained vast networks, held together by complex infrastructure.

I was a part of many clubs and organizations at UWO . I was involved in community service. I never had a hard time getting by . I worked on a local radio station and a television station . After graduating I worked in construction. In the early 1980's I owned a successful dry cleaning and furniture business. I was on the board of directors of a local church .

Will an upcoming vote in Congress signal the end of Medicare? In the next few weeks Congress will decide whether to cut $54 billion in overpayments to Medicare insurers, igniting a battle that may well determine whether the program survives. On one side are Medicare supporters, who want it to continue as a successful social insurance program. On the other is the insurance industry, which is spending millions and lobbying hard to put Medicare on a fast track to privatization, a goal long sought by fiscal conservatives and their allies in right-wing think tanks.

The Toronto real estate market is showing signs of stirring from its deep freeze, with new listings starting to pick up — and an almost 8 per cent spike in prices — as of mid February, year over year, according to figures released Wednesday. Some 2,767 properties were sold during the first two weeks of February, up just 1.3 per cent from the same period a year ago, says the Toronto Real Estate Board. But the average sale price was up 7.8 per cent to $547,107 from the $507,474 recorded in the first two weeks of February 2013.

While Eilidh, Nick and Alison are seasoned campaigners, Isabella is only 16 years old and attends Kings Priory School in Tynemouth. She is, however, a member of the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain. The programme was most challenging and varied, consisting of five compositions.

The team that brought you driverless cars and Siri is now fighting a new kind of war on information. In the world of internet memes, Instagram filters, and Photoshop, seeing is no longer believing. Everyone is a photographer or videographer once they have a smartphone in their hands, which often comes equipped with alteration tools already installed. But manipulations that started with cropping and teeth-whitening have spurred into the spread of misinformation. In developed capitalist democracies , financial , media and energy companies are private enterprises that don ’ t report to governments, regulators or the public. Instead, they operate as independent, autonomous, profit-seeking organizations, with the ability to create wealth and influence government policy and legislation through lobbying , direct funding of politicians and use of the public purse. The world’s first publicly owned financial company, the privately owned Royal Bank of Scotland , set up to provide liquidity to British and other global financial institutions, was established in 1707 and has become a fixture of global capitalism.

For Bruce Logan , microbes are an electrifying subject . The Kappe professor of environmental engineering at Pennsylvania State University’s Wharton School has worked with bacteria since the 1990s in an attempt to understand how their ability to resist the effects of environmental change can benefit human society as well as their microbial hosts. Now he’s doing just that by collaborating with scientists in the United Arab Emirates to discover whether bacteria in the desert are vulnerable to the same threats as those encountered by their microbial neighbors in the temperate and tropical zones of the globe. His new work appears in the June issue of Science.

A local nonprofit whose mission is to transform the lives of at-risk youths will host its sixth annual fiesta fundraiser on Dec. 1 from noon to 2 p.m. in the Piedra Room at Cerrillos Center. This year’s festivities will be the largest fundraiser in Cerrillos history, and it will also become the third fiesta to take place there in a decade and the first fiesta to do so in the greater San Antonio area. Rising up from a need-to-know theme, the fiesta has been named in honor of one of the largest Hispanic-owned organizations in Texas: the Puerto Rican Community Services Association.

The pheasant-hunting season in New York is under way , and thanks to a great stocking program hunters should find that they have lots of good birds on the market. The season, which lasts for only three weeks, began on July 10 and is scheduled to conclude on the 23rd of the following month. The great horned owl is being hunted, along with the white-tail, as well as the red fox, white-shouldered dove and great blue heron. Other birds hunted include wood duck, water rail and red-billed horned. New York City’s red squirrels are also being hunted.

In the opening scene we see these ships and we think they might be an ancient legend , but it turns out to be the real thing . As the ships move on , we see that they’re moving to a city , a city that is surrounded by mountains and we wonder how they got there .

Carton House : The 668-acre mansion , hotel and golf and sports facilities “ reached consensual agreement with Nama to share the revenue from the sale and marketing of its commercial properties. “ The deal will allow the hotel to operate on an “honor system.” For years, Nama had been buying hotel rooms at a profit, charging them high rates to stay in one of its most expensive resorts. It was common for its luxury hotels to be worth as much as $1 million a room, with the resort charging $300 to book a room. But Nama now has an even more lucrative arrangement.

The Volstead Act was repealed on this date in 1933 , returning control of alcohol to the states , and thus removing the federal prohibition against the sale and transportation of liquor. This date is significant because it marked the end of Prohibition as a national policy and the beginning of the era of the free flow of liquor in the United States . Prohibition expired on December 6, 1933 , but it was revived in the state of Hawaii , the first state to reestablish Prohibition after the federal repeal and the first to hold a full session of its legislature on this date, April 5, 1933 .

The Texas Supreme Court has transferred about 80 cases from El Paso's 8th Court of Appeals in a first of its kind move to reduce a growing backlog. AUSTIN — In an unprecedented move, the Texas Supreme Court has stripped more than 80 cases from the 8th Court of Appeals in El Paso due to the court's growing backlog. The cases, some of which are up to 3 years old, are being transferred to other appeals courts in Texas. Most are at the final stage of processing, awaiting a decision from the three justices on El Paso's court.

In 1890, a group of eight large New York City bakeries combined to form the New York Biscuit Company and built a giant six-story factory in West Chelsea. Eight years later, they merged with their competitor, Chicago's American Biscuit and Manufacturing to form an even larger conglomerate – the National Biscuit Company, but the factory and headquarters remained in Chelsea. In 1901, the National Biscuit Company put their abbreviated company name on a box of wafers for the first time – Nabisco. Soon, Nabisco became the company's official name.

A group of Solomon Islands timber exporters and government officials is visiting Australia and New Zealand this week. The export mission starts in Brisbane from 22 – 25 March and moves to Auckland from 25-30 March 2015. The group will meet with importers and government officials including a meeting with the New Zealand Timber Importers Association at the Pacific Islands Trade & Invest office in Newmarket. As 60% of sawn timber is sold to markets in Australia and New Zealand, the visits aim to increase understanding among both exporters and importers of market requirements and opportunities for Solomon Islands sawn timber.

HERTFORD, N.C. — Hertford police say a 10-month-old boy is dead after a dog attacked him while he was in the care of his grandmother. The Daily Advance of Elizabeth City reports that Hertford Police Chief Doug Freeman said the mixed breed dog bit the child all over his body. The child was transported to Albemarle Hospital by Perquimans County emergency personnel who tried the save the child by administering CPR. The boy died at the hospital Tuesday evening. Freeman said the grandmother fainted in the yard of the home and was also taken to the hospital.

In 1890 , a group of eight large New York City bakeries combined to form the New York Biscuit Company (later known as the Biscuit Corporation) . The name "biscuit" was first adopted by the New York City Police Department, but was soon adopted for a variety of baked goods. Contents show]

Early history

In the summer of 1867, the New York Times announced that the Biscuit Factory would be the first baker's cooperative in the New England area. In 1868 they opened the first bakery in Syracuse, New York. They were able to expand their operations quickly, opening a new factory in 1891.

Hybrid Cloud: Wave of the Future or Digital Chimera? Home Blogs Infrastructure Hybrid Cloud: Wave Of The Future Or Digital Chimera? The hybrid cloud remains the top infrastructure initiative in the enterprise, but it is a huge undertaking and leads into such deep, uncharted waters that it is by no means a smooth transition. Quite naturally, as the difficulties mount, more voices are starting to call the wisdom of the hybrid cloud into question. Does it really provide the benefits that supporters claim? Is it really the best way to prepare for the emerging digital economy?

The Nicholls softball team staged a strong defensive effort Wednesday night against Southern Mississippi in its home opener at Swanner Park. The Bulldogs (2-6) took advantage of several errors by Nicholls batters, and the Panthers (1-6) had to work to get out of the early hole they were in. The Lady Panthers were held to just five hits on the evening, with just one run being unearned. With the win, Nicholls clinched their first SEC West title since 2001. The Lady Panthers will next travel to Tennessee (3-3) next Wednesday for a non-league contest in Nashville.

( CNN ) -- Thousands of people in Northern Ireland protested Wednesday against the killing of two soldiers and a police officer who died after their patrol vehicle hit the roadside bomb in Belfast. Protests were planned for the afternoon in Northern Ireland on Thursday. The protests were called by the Northern Ireland Forum for Peace and Reintegration, an activist group which campaigns on behalf of those in the community who feel neglected by the authorities in the wake of the peace process, including in the province of the province's capital city of Belfast.

A truck slammed into a fire hydrant on Western Avenue in San Pedro on Thursday morning , creating a geyser of water and sending flames shooting into a neighborhood in the area known as El Cerrito. About 10:15 a.m., a car pulled up to the scene and a woman who was in the driver's seat told the driver that she needed to use the bathroom before the fire hydrant near her home on El Cerrito Avenue. She got out of her car and went inside. She said a fire hydrant on the corner of El Cerrito Avenue and Western Avenue was damaged by the truck, and firefighters were called.

Veronica Fatia carries her 2-year-old daughter as they travel in a wooden boat to Buzi district, 120 miles outside Beira, Mozambique, on Saturday, March 23, 2019. They left the cyclone-shattered city of Beira for the town of Buzi, which for a week people had been fleeing to with little but their clothes. The young mother huddled on a wooden boat clutching her 2-year-old daughter, headed for the unknown: The flooded town of Buzi, which thousands have fled with little but the clothes on their backs. Fishermen's boats have been ferrying out Buzi's displaced, sometimes scores of people crammed into a single vessel.

Planting the Savannah grasses in front of Cary Home seemed like a good idea in 2013, when they received a grant for the project. LAFAYETTE, Ind. — Planting the Savannah grasses in front of Cary Home seemed like a good idea in 2013, when it received a grant for the project. The Brexit crowd refused to believe the experts in the run-up to the referendum vote . The warnings from every source – from the Leave campaign to experts on the EU – were that a “no-deal” scenario – where Britain remained locked into the EU single market for ever – would be a catastrophe, with the entire economy falling apart. It was a scenario the Leave campaigners were so sure would happen that they even had a mock-up in place, ready to be put to the people of Britain before the snap election. The Brexit campaign argued that this was exactly the sort of scenario that the electorate would accept.

SHAH ALAM ( THE STAR/ASIA NEWS NETWORK ) - The High Court in Shah Alam has rejected a bid to challenge a verdict by the Kuala Lumpur Sessions Court, which handed down life jail sentences to five people accused of trying to import and import/export three tonnes of cocaine. A plea on behalf of two of the five people who have been convicted for importing cocaine said they were “beyond rehabilitation.”

“We appeal on the grounds of human right, not just the right to human rights, which was breached,” said the plea filed by the two people.

Riders can rent a Spin electric scooter for $1 plus 15 cents per minute, making it an affordable option for short trips. As part of Ford, Spin plans to 'expand aggressively,' giving more people the opportunity to try its service. To start out, Spin is launching today in Detroit. Ford is beefing up its first and last mile transportation offerings. On Thursday, the automaker announced it has acquired electric scooter startup Spin. Founded in San Francisco in 2016, the dockless scooter sharing company currently operates in 13 cities and campuses throughout the US.

Banking giant Standard Chartered on Tuesday announced a return of dividends for shareholders after a two-year hiatus as it reported a surge in annual profits following restructuring and cutbacks. The Asia-focused lender said it would pay out a full-year dividend of 11 cents per share, citing "improving financial performance and strong capital". It also said pre-tax profit jumped 175 percent on-year to $3.01 billion in 2017. Shares in the firm rose almost two percent in afternoon Hong Kong trading, having been in negative territory before the results were announced during the break.

The first image of Earth from lunar orbit . Before an Apollo-era NASA could launch a few humans on top of the Moon, an Earth satellite had to be built. (credit: NASA, ESA, H. Schulman)



In the early 1950s the U.S. Space Program launched several satellites in what was the first space age: the manned Apollo program in the 1960s made the Earth's Moon possible. (Credit: U.S. Space Administration) In the early 1960s NASA's Mercury program had built a lunar orbiting spacecraft. But it would take several years to develop a large-scale mission to Mars.

Peter Brimelow writes : On November 21 , 2008 , I spoke in Baltimore at the inaugural meeting of the American Jewish Committee for International Affairs (AJCIA). As I began speaking I could hear applause from a few in the audience. I thanked them and said that I felt that I had a good reception, which was gratifying to me.

Peter Brown took the precaution of carrying a parachute on his home-made plane but it wasn't enough to save him. Mr Brown, 57, was found dead inside the wreckage of his home-made ultralight after crashing in trees, metres from the Lovedale Store and Cafe in the Hunter Valley cafe yesterday. Hunter Valley Inspector Peter Vromans confirmed his parachute was onboard but it had not been deployed. "That will be part of the investigations," he said. Recreational Aviation Australia president Michael Monck said parachutes were not mandatory on flights, though they could add an extra element of safety.

BANGKOK ( Reuters ) - The leader of Thailand ’ s military junta said on Thursday that Yingluck Shinawatra , prime minister of a coalition government, was not in a coma but had a “medical issue” and had to be in a hospital. A statement from the military-backed administration, published on state-run Thaksinairao.com, said Yingluck, who was prime minister when she died at the end of December, had suffered from an “unstable medical problem” since early March. “She has had to be hospitalised. Her condition is still stable,” the statement said without giving details.

Testimony began Monday in Carrie Lea Reynolds ' trial . She is charged with second-degree murder in the death of a woman found face down in bed by her boyfriend in November. A jury found Reynolds guilty Thursday and she faces life in prison at a hearing next Wednesday. According to the prosecutor, Reynolds strangled, choked and hit the woman repeatedly in the head and body. She also admitted to killing her mother and sister as a teenager and in the past, she has confessed to killing two other people, according to the Associated Press.

The Fox Sports commentary team covering an Australian Boomers basketball game have been left in a state of shock after the Australian women's basketball team won its sixth straight World Cup title. Last year's World Cup final between the USA and Brazil was a closely contested affair that went to overtime, with the Brazilians coming on a last-second three-pointer at the final buzzer. This year's tournament will be played over three days and it is the biggest game of the Boomers' six-year history, with the US squad playing in front of an expected sell-out crowd that has been growing steadily.

The new law finishes old business in Trenton and expands the so-called Tuition Equality Act , which let qualified immigrants bring in $15,600 a year to pay off student loans for their kids . Tuition-shaming is not a good idea. And it’s not even fair. When I was a college student, it was all about getting the education I deserved and helping my fellow students get ahead in life. Now that students have to pay for it all themselves, with no government help, this is unfair to them. There are also other costs, like increased taxes and higher costs for housing.

While it’s not the most glamorous construction project, the state Department of Transportation says it’s something that needs fixing. No, we’re not talking about something on the scale of four Route 8/25 bridges in Bridgeport that were demolished and erected over just one summer. It’s the replacement of old sign supports that hold up those large green signs that direct us at intersections and exits. “The new sign supports are necessary because the old sign supports have reached the end of their life expectancy. The new supports will comply with the latest state and federal standards,” DOT says.

ST. PAUL -- Minnesota Wild General Manager Paul Fenton today announced the National Hockey League (NHL) club has signed forward Matt Read to a one-year, two-way contract ($650,000/$200,000). Read, 32, collected 16 points (7-9=16) and eight penalty minutes (PIM) in 33 games with Lehigh Valley in the American Hockey League (AHL) and scored one goal in 19 games with Philadelphia in 2017-18. The 5-foot-10, 185-pound native of Ilderton, Ont., collected two points (1-1=2) and four PIM appearing in all six Stanley Cup playoff contests with the Flyers.

Low-income working families are losing hundreds of pounds each year – and being wrongly denied free healthcare entitlements – because of flaws in the way universal credit is designed, campaigners say. The Child Poverty Action Group (CPAG ) said arbitrary rules built in to the way universal credit is calculated leave some families unable to predict how much they will be paid each month, leaving households in debt and unable to budget. It can lead to claimants being wrongly benefit-capped – a penalty designed to “incentivise” jobless or low-earning households by severely limiting their benefits – because the system fails to spot they are working and earning enough.

The Banner Health Clinic , located at 615 Fairhurst St. in Sterling , welcomes Eli Avery , FNP-C. As a senior in the Department of Emergency Medicine, Avery has extensive experience in both community and specialty practice. Avery has been accepted into a residency at the Mayo Clinic Residency Program in Cardiovascular Care, where he will focus on a subspecialty in percutaneous coronary intervention. Avery is a graduate of Boston University's School of Public Health and of the University of Rochester Medical School, where he was also the editor-in-chief of The Cardiovascular Journal. Avery completed a fellowship in Community Health Sciences at the Harvard Medical School.

Why do we only hear about Jasper Johns when he gets ripped off ? Jasper Johns is the greatest artist of our generation, and now he is on trial for ripping off the world ? How did he get away with it? How many artists have ever been exposed for rip offs before he gets away with it? How many have ever been accused of rip offs ? The fact is that it only took Jasper a decade to get off, but now it’s just happening all the time. Is there not some kind of a balance to be found, as to whether Jasper is guilty or not?

WINNIPEG — Turning trash into treasure is somewhat of an art form , but the new season of a HGTV reality show about homes is making it more difficult for homeowners in Winnipeg to sell the stuff they won’t use up. “I think you can get a house for under a million dollars, and you can get it for under $400,000,” said one of the hosts of a show that aired last year about homes. “I think that’s pretty amazing, and I would never have been able to get it for that amount of money.

MANSEHRA , Nov 27 : Provincial Minister for Haj and Auqaf Nimroz Khan on Tuesday said time was not far when Muslims in Afghanistan would stand up to their oppressors. “The time was far and now the time has come when the oppressors should be brought to justice. I urge all Muslims to support the Taliban and to stand with the people of Afghanistan in their struggle against the occupation forces and their sponsors,” he added. Imran Khan was also briefed about the visit of the Secretary General of the United Nations (UN) to the country in the wake of recent violence in Kabul.

Evo Morales , Bolivia 's president-elect , fresh from meetings with the leaders of Cuba and Venezuela , says that he will continue to talk with his Latin American neighbours about the problems shared by their peoples, even if relations between the two countries remain tense. "We want to have a good dialogue with those countries so that they can make use of what they have in common with us," he told the BBC. "It is important for us to talk about this, to discuss these issues so that there's no misunderstanding between our countries."

LITCHFIELD , Maine ( AP ) — A Maine woman is trying to protect a series of osprey nests atop her family's farm. Brianna Brown and her family moved from Massachusetts to the rural town of Litchfield in the 1980s. But she has found it hard to leave the nest sites, and she's now trying to keep the ospreys out of her driveway. "It's a little scary now, because there's a few of them," Brown said. Brown said the nests are the property of the town and are the property of the state.

The newest entry to the robo-advisory service is TIAA . Part of the allure for firms is to appeal to them, but there are ways to do so without actually talking to clients. For one, there is an online form and a phone chat option if the firm needs assistance. The form includes questions related to:

Why are they calling, and what are the issues they want resolved? What’s the process and timeline? Who is the client and what are their expectations? How long will the process take? How much will it cost to talk to them?

So the latest Star Wars game has made tea-bagging Darth Vader ’ s smug Jedi son ’ s face an artform again. We’re still not sure what Darth Vader is but we do know what tea is – it’s an all-purpose tea-making substance that’s produced from tea leaves and has become one of the most iconic and important tea brands around. As such, tea has become a staple of any Star Wars fan’s cupboard, but how much does it cost to make and how much can you get away with drinking?

The European Commission is considering legal action against EU member states to protect farm animals from suffering in hot weather while waiting at the Bulgarian-Turkish border. This can be concluded from the commission's response to an EUobserver access to documents request, which asked for recent correspondence between the commission and EU capitals about the transport of animals to Turkey. "The documents requested are letters exchanged with member states in the context of an ongoing administrative investigation on the implementation of regulation (EC) No 1/2005," said the commission's directorate-general for health and food safety in a letter to EUobserver.

- Are these the phones Samsung plans to announce? We're two days into 2018 and already the new year is treating us well. The leak (below), spotted by Androidandme, was shared to the Chinese site Weibo, and it shows the backside of the Galaxy S9 and S9+. Although it looks legit, nothing has been confirmed by Samsung.

Many Alberta small-business owners , who have been struggling through a prolonged economic downturn , are hoping the next provincial election campaign will offer them some relief. “For some of our employees, the downturn is a long-term problem, because it’s only been going on for five to 10 years now,” said Richard Cottrell, president and CEO of the Alberta Employers’ Federation (AEF), “but there are still many people that are losing their jobs or are struggling to find a job in Alberta, but they’re hopeful they can get it back on track if they’re willing to work hard.

Marine Le Pen, the French National Front political party leader, at an FN political rally in Frejus. French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen is not the biggest fan of the euro. "The euro is not a currency," she said earlier this month. "It is a political weapon to force countries to implement the policies decided by the [European Union] and keep them on a leash. "Look at what happened to the Greeks when they said no to austerity, as they were right to do: Liquidity for the banks was cut off."

Some restaurateurs are altering menus to accommodate dieters on macro diets. When Chicago-native Vince Schiano was working toward his goal to drop body fat, he’d often carry around a food scale, protein powder and a tupperware full of ground beef or turkey. Vince Schiano started macro dieting in 2016 to lose fat. The diet is different for each person. For example, an active 130-pound adult following a 1,600-calorie diet could opt for 40% of calories from carbs; 30% from protein; and 30% from fat, Runners World recommends.

It takes a community to help migrant workers who need affordable medical care and social assistance. This is the belief of Dr Goh Wei Leong, co-founder of HealthServe, which has grown from strength to strength and marks the 10th anniversary of its first clinic this year. "Its not just about dishing out medicine. It's about the human community. (In the early days), I realised we needed social workers, counsellors and legal advisory." The non-governmental organisation has dental and medical clinics in Geylang, Mandai and Jurong catering to migrant workers. It also provides social assistance to those in distress.

BUHLER - The south wall of Jim Baker Fieldhouse is considered hallowed ground at Buhler High. It's reserved for the Crusaders' state championship plaques - 36 of them in all. But none of them are in football. Coach Steve Warner wants to change that on Saturday when his Crusaders travel to Salina to play in their first state title game since 1990. Buhler (12-1) faces Coffeyville in the Kansas Class 4A championship game at 1 p.m., and a week of preparation has featured a buzz in a town that is ravenous for a first-ever state football championship.

The Brother MFC-J775DW is a low-priced inkjet with very low running costs and a basic feature set for a home-office all-in-one printer. Low price. Very low running costs. Above-par overall output quality, led by very good text quality. Modest paper capacity. Lacks Ethernet connectivity. Can't print from USB thumb drives or memory cards. Non-duplex ADF. The Brother MFC-J775DW ($149.99) color inkjet all-in-one printer is a good choice for light-duty use in a micro or home office. It avails itself of Brother's high-yield INKvestment cartridges to provide substantial savings in ink costs.

For Bruce Logan, microbes are an electrifying subject. The Kappe professor of environmental engineering at Pennsylvania State University works on creating alternative-fuel cells powered by anaerobic bacteria. "Because these bacteria breathe without oxygen they will transfer electrons from their food outside their bodies to an electrode," he says. Enough bacteria doing this at the same time will generate a current. At just a few millivolts It won't charge a phone, but it's enough to get a reading. Drill a hole for the copper wire in the lid of each container.

WASHINGTON — House Democrats on Friday unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package that targets what they call a "dark web" of sites used to circumvent U.S. restrictions against foreign political ads. "We’re taking on the internet giants who control the internet and, in particular, what happens in America’s shadow markets," House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Richard Neal said on "Fox News Sunday." The plan, he said, "would help bring the dark web to a halt for good."

Boeing’s latest setback, a deal between Tesla and Fiat Chrysler, and Pinterest’s valuation were in focus as markets geared up for another week on Monday. The venerable British ultrapremium car maker saw its stock hammered after its October public listing. Now with solid management and new models, its stock should accelerate. Ferrari NV RACE Tuesday raised its dividend for the year by 45%. The Italian car maker proposed a dividend of 1.03 euros ($1.17) a share for 2018, up from EUR0.71 for 2017. Ferrari said this is equivalent to a total payout of about EUR194 million.

California Communities Demand `` Rent Control Now ! '' Efforts to stabilize communities in California with with much needed rent control may soon be afoot once again, as the state is poised to introduce a sweeping new rent-control reform bill that is expected to take effect on June 5th. The bill, SB 1421, was introduced earlier this year by Assembly Speaker Robert Hertzberg (R-Van Nuys) and Assemblywoman Lorena Gonzalez (D-Sherman Oaks). This measure is the product of an arduous legislative process with many attempts to get the necessary legislation past the state Senate and Assembly.

Running errands on your bicycle is a great way to burn calories and get some exercise. When you need something small or you are just checking prices and availability, pedaling to the store can be a pleasant experience if you can find a bicycle-friendly route. Several major shopping locations in the Rogue Valley can be accessed by bicycles without encountering excessive traffic. For example, both the Rogue Valley Mall and the Medford Shopping Center are easily accessible from the Bear Creek Greenway bicycle path. It is somewhat more difficult to ride a bike to the big-box stores along Highway 62 (Crater Lake Highway).

After Superman and Mission : Impossible – Fallout , Henry Cavill has landed another highly coveted role . On Tuesday ( October 3 ), he will play Bruce Wayne/Batman, a new hero for the Dark Knight universe . The casting is a little odd, considering that Cavill only recently wrapped up The Batman . That’s not to say Cavill is a bad actor — it’s more just the nature of the genre in which the actor is working. For most fans of superhero movies, that’s usually where they get their best work.

What Steve Lonegan can teach Republicans about making life hell for Democrats . New Jersey Senate candidate Steve Lonegan may be the most liberal Republican candidate in the country, and he is running against the most liberal Democrat in the Senate: Sen. Cory Booker . But the two have something else in common: the very fact that they are Republicans. Lonegan and Booker are both from New Jersey. "Cory is not a Democrat," Lonegan told me this week in an email exchange. "He may be an Independent, but we are all Republicans in New Jersey."

The woman was walking home from the Naylor Road Metro Station about 12:05 a.m. Dec. 3 when she was forced from her car at a red light and shoved into an oncoming van. The woman, who was not identified, was pronounced dead at a hospital. No names or ages of the victims were released. A spokesman for the North Dakota Department of Health told News 2 that while a death investigation was underway, there were no pending criminal charges against the drivers of the vehicle or their passengers. The incident was first reported by the Fargo Journal-Tribune and is being investigated by the North Dakota Board on Geographic Names.

The last was wide receiver Corey Coleman during the 2012 season who said , per CSN New York , "Mayfield will be a Heisman trophy winner this year because he'll do what he does best on the field."

Big Data is transforming the way Canadian businesses are able to build meaningful relationships with their customers . Today the data you collect, and how you use it to power your business, are just as critical as the data you generate. Whether you are a new business owner, a seasoned business professional, or a data manager, you’ve likely faced challenges with your data strategy. Whether you want to collect data on every interaction you have with new customers, or generate data on your existing customers, your data strategy can have the biggest impact. But where does the data go?

The proposal that foreign powers acquire land in Africa to stem migration is nothing but 'hipster' colonialism. Last week, Germany's Africa Commissioner Gunter Nooke said that European countries should be allowed to lease land and to build and run cities in Africa as a means of stemming what he views as the unchecked expansion of migration from Africa to Europe. For Nooke, allowing the "free development" of these areas would stimulate African economies and create "growth and prosperity" and therefore, reduce the attractiveness of Europe as a destination for migration. The proposal has elicited mixed reactions.

Eurovision 2018 was winner Netta Barzilai ’ s finest hour , and moment of national pride for all of Israel . The contest’s two-day run-up and final took place in Tel Aviv last Sunday , the final night of the Israel Festival, marking the 70th anniversary of Israel Independence and in celebration of Tel Aviv’s becoming a ‘ city of light ’. And what a light show it was! From the dazzling fireworks that lit up the skies and the pyrotechnics that lit up city streets to the breathtaking displays of colour, grace and glamour that lit up both Tel Aviv and Jerusalem .

Best Buy Co. Inc. shares surged 9 % in premarket trade after the electronics retailer & apos ; s fiscal first-quarter ended on a weak Q1 result announced in late December, said on Tuesday the company's CEO. Apos's earnings for Q1 were well above analysts' expectations as the company reported adjusted EPS of 37 cents per share, a 43% rise on year-ago EPS of 11 cents per share, a 9% rise from the same period in 2010, compared to analysts' expectations of 32 cents per share on revenues of $2.5 billion, adjusted for one-time items, of the quarter.

Considering all the comings and goings of people involved in the project, we should be grateful that Bohemian Rhapsody has finally landed on the big screen. Changing directors and lead actors puts a seed of doubt in minds as to how successful a film is likely to be. However, it’s a worthy biopic of Freddie Mercury, and Queen. There’s no argument that Rami Malek is great as the famed lead singer, but Ben Hardy (Roger Taylor), Gwilym Lee (Brian May) and Joseph Mazzello (John Deacon) also look and sound the part.

Sean Bean has made a career of being around royalty in epic fantasy . He was the heir to the throne of King Vortigern when his eldest daughter died and the kingdom was in chaos. And so he did what he believed was right for his realm and his family. He did his best to keep them safe so they could fulfill their responsibilities to the kingdom and the kingdom to them and their heirs. And then they all went up in flames. His wife, he thought it was his daughter, did her duty. He believed she was his heir, and when he died the kingdom fell into chaos again.

BOB Cole died yesterday . Around 2pm in a purpose-built flat on a Swiss industrial estate outside Zurich , he took his life, apparently by jumping from a balcony in a suicide pact, police say. No suicide note has been found. Mr Cole, 27, worked for the German car-maker Audi and was due to retire next year, according to a friend. A Swiss newspaper said he had left behind a wife, two sons and a daughter. The friend, whom the Times does not name, described the family as "courageous and good" .

Australia 's Cordell Jigsaw Zapruder has got a toe-hold on New Zealand 's reality TV , buying Greenstone TV for a whopping $2.3M in cash . The new network will air reality TV, news, sports and entertainment from a number of international broadcasters with a focus on international news, current affairs, culture, politics, science, business, technology, education, arts and social issues. “I think it’s good for New Zealand, it’s good for our country in general. It does give a much wider range of people the opportunity to be able to be part of the coverage,” he said .

MASSENA – Mr. William V. Cameron, Jr., 62, a resident of Olympia, Washington and a 1977 graduate of Massena Central School, passed away August 31, 2018 in Olympia after a brief illness. William is survived by his daughters, Tina and Josh Rozner of Fulton and Natasha Soucy of Rochester; five grandchildren; his sisters, Ann Cameron of Kissimmee, Florida, Mary Martin, and Patricia and Judy Cameron, all of Massena; his brother, Michael Cameron of Norfolk; and aunts, uncles, nieces, nephews and cousins.

LITCHFIELD, Maine (AP) — A Maine woman is trying to protect a series of osprey nests atop power poles that are threatened by a $1.55 billion project to modernize the state's power distribution system. But so far Rebecca Loveland of Litchfield has been unsuccessful in her campaign to spare the nests or at least provide alternatives for the big birds' homes. Poles supporting the nests will be removed as part of Central Maine Power Company's modernization effort known as the Maine Power Reliability Project. Loveland tells the Kennebec Journal at least 60 osprey nests will be removed.

CINCINNATI -- As FC Cincinnati fans chanted and cheered for taxpayers to help fund a Major League Soccer stadium, Hamilton County leaders laid out a bleak reality: The county has too many projects and no way to pay for them all. From an outdated convention center to the obsolete Western Hills Viaduct, Hamilton County Commissioners are trying to figure out how to pay for more than $1.5 billion worth of infrastructure, development, transportation and county building needs in the coming years. "We have more projects than we have money," Hamilton County Commission President Todd Portune told a crowd of at least 150 people Tuesday night.

The Jawbone Up debuted last year with big ambitions : A bracelet-like device that you 'd wear all the time, and use to monitor your sleep, alert you when you need to get up and move around, and even play games, such as a rhythm game that would track your pulse rate.' Now the company has delivered on its promises : You can use the new Up to track sleep patterns, track your sleep cycle, sleep stage and activity. The Up also has an accelerometer, microphone and LED light, giving it all the power of a conventional wristband.

HERTFORD , N.C. — Hertford police say a 10-month-old boy is dead after a dog attacked him while he was in his parents' car. The boy's father and his brother found the dog around 4:15 a.m. Sunday in the parking lot at an apartment complex in the city's north end. An investigator who spoke to the Herald on Monday said the animal was attacked by the dog in an apparent act of aggression. He said the boy suffered "multiple, severe" injuries. The animal's condition was listed as critical and he was taken to the hospital.
