Selkirk Avenue was closed down for several hours by a fire. At around 10 a.m. Monday, Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service crews responded to a fire in a vacant commercial building in the 400 block of Selkirk. Crews evacuated nearby buildings as a precaution and one individual from a neighbouring building was assessed on scene. The road was closed to traffic for around two and a half hours. Officials said that the fire progressed into the roof of an attached residential-style portion of the building. Crews contained the fire to the building of origin using several handheld hose lines and an aerial ladder for safety.

After seven seasons together with the Cubs, could the Theo Trio be on the verge of a breakup? That could depend on the Giants. Or the Mets. Both are looking for new general managers, and Jason McLeod, the Cubs’ top scouting and player-development executive, already has been linked to both. The Giants job opened Monday with Bobby Evans’ firing. “I’m not actively looking because of how great things are here,” said McLeod, who sat alongside team president Theo Epstein and general manager Jed Hoyer during the fall 2011 news conference introducing them as the Cubs’ new front-office regime.

The 2014 Chevrolet Camaro Z28 . DETROIT — General Motors is recalling more cars for problems with ignition switches . GM says it is recalling approximately 2,500 cars because the switch has the potential to fail to turn off the engine or fail to turn off the motor’s starter. The company said there have been no injuries as a result. GM says a small number of cars were sold with faulty ignition switches and are being recalled because the switch may have been installed incorrectly or may not be installed correctly or may have a different pin configuration than indicated on the instructions.

The thorny question of abortion rights is again taking center stage on Beacon Hill and putting some top officials in jeopardy, as pro-life activists plan to gather at the Capitol for the second anniversary of President Obama's inauguration on Tuesday, Feb. 19. Several prominent lawmakers and officials, including Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid (D-Nev.) and House Speaker John Boehner (R-Ohio), have been at odds over abortion since they were elected to Congress five years ago. They have spoken out on the topic at a news conference, a fundraiser and at an election forum hosted by pro-life organizations.

Against the odds , Auburn Smith , 16 , has become a nationally ranked wheelchair tennis player . She will be taking her shot at the NCAA singles championships this week , and her coach will be counting on her to compete . "This is going to be a very special moment in my career and I am excited to experience something I never thought I would," said Auburn Smith . "It's a great honor for me, and I want to make the NCAA team and represent my country at the highest level. "

Some restaurateurs are altering menus to accommodate dieters on macro diets . When Chicago-native Vince Schiano was working toward his culinary doctorate at Chicago’s Copley Jesuit College, he thought his “macro” food would look and taste better than his traditional, “paleo” fare. He had a hunch it wouldn’t be so difficult. “I just felt that if I could do it, everyone could do it,” says Schiano, who runs a restaurant in Chicago called the Blue Room, which specializes in Italian dishes and also has a restaurant in Manhattan. He was wrong.

An Austrian man has nearly burned down his home in an attempt to get rid of a mouse . The man, identified by the Austrian press as an "expert on rats", had already set fire to his house before his home caught fire, because he was worried that he had just killed a rat in the process. The mouse, which was the size of a house cat, had been left in a crate in the garage and had already been put out to fend for itself by the time the fire started, said the Austrian newspaper SZ.

AFC Fylde ’ s match at Torquay United has been postponed following a Friday morning pitch inspection at Plainmoor . The decision has been taken to postpone the match after the inspection found that the grass was too short in the south stand. There is no suggestion that this was the result of any wrongdoing by the club, but the decision was taken with due regard to the potential impact on the match’s running order. It will be rescheduled to a date to be confirmed. “The inspection revealed that the pitch was not in good condition and the club is currently carrying out the necessary work to correct the problem.

HLAAF—Harvard Latin American Alumni and Friends—launched its Facebook page in March 2013, hosted its first official alumni reception that May, launched its official website (www.harvardlatinamerica.org) this past June, and in October helped sponsor the first Latin America Career Fair at Harvard. That event—run by HLAAF, the Office of Career Services, the David Rockefeller Center for Latin American Studies, and the Harvard-affiliated Academic and Professional Programs for the Americas (LASPAU)—drew 120 undergraduate and graduate students, as well as LASPAU fellows and a mix of employers ranging from U.S. and Latin-American companies to nonprofit groups, reports HLAAF president María Carla Chicuen ’10.

In a democracy , it is said , we get the government we deserve . The same can be said about the political parties. These parties are not responsible for the poor performances of their candidates. We should not blame our political parties for not doing the job of selecting our representatives. The fact is that the majority of our politicians are people who should not have become legislators at all , let alone become members of a political party. The reality is that the majority of political parties do not have a competent leader, let alone a competent team of leaders.

The word hero gets thrown around so much that its use has lost much of the intended impact . Indie-published authors seem happy to describe their creations as heroes and villains alike, and that’s what we are going to cover today. I hope this series will be a good fit for readers of all skill levels. I have no experience with martial arts, but I have spent a fair amount of time as an instructor and I love to write stories about what it takes to do what you love with a weapon you’ve never before had the desire to wield.

The Banner Health Clinic, located at 615 Fairhurst St. in Sterling, welcomes Eli Avery, FNP-C. As a family nurse practitioner, Avery specializes in community-based primary care across the whole age spectrum, with a focus on wellness and preventive healthcare. Avery is a recent graduate from the University of New Hampshire University where he was a participant in the Live, Learn and Play in Northern New Hampshire program, an internship with a focus on health care for rural medically underserved populations. Avery has extensive experience in health care, previously working as a registered nurse in New Hampshire in surgery and the emergency room.

The Brexit crowd refused to believe the experts in the run-up to the referendum vote. The warnings from every leading economic body, including the Bank of England, were dismissed as scaremongering that should be ignored. Now, apparently, the words of the Governor of the Bank of England and other economists are so influential they can talk us into a recession – I am baffled by this double-think. But we need not agonise over all the talk now, because the facts are mounting up. Last week, we reported exclusive figures showing a sharp fall in the number of shoppers out on our high streets.

HARRY REDKNAPP went to Madrid to scout goal thief Diego Forlan on Thursday night but ended up being mugged himself. He was targeted by pickpockets outside the Vicente Calderon stadium before the game where he intended watching Atletico Madrid striker Forlan and Real midfielder Lassana Diarra – who did not play. Redknapp, who lost several hundred pounds of cash and credit cards, said: “Forlan’s a good, interesting player. But it was difficult to concentrate on the game, because I got mugged, had my pockets picked, before the game. It was strange, weird.

Richard Drew/Associated PressThe normally busy trading floor will be empty on Monday. All United States stock and options markets will close on Monday as Hurricane Sandy approaches, as Wall Street braces for the storm to barrel through the heart of the country’s financial center. The decision, made on Sunday night, leaves the American stock markets closed for weather conditions for the first time in nearly three decades. The New York Stock Exchange had previously planned on closing only its physical trading floor, while allowing for trading on its Arca electronic exchange. It has now decided to halt all trading.

Student Senators passed a resolution that would have NYU divest from three companies associated with the Israeli government and institute a “socially responsible” investment policy. 63 members of student government voted on the resolution. A resolution that would have NYU divest from companies associated with Israel and institute a socially responsible investment policy on Thursday. Of the 63 senators voting, 14 abstained, 14 voted no and 35 voted yes. At least a hundred students crowded the Colloquium Room on the fifth floor of the Global Center for Academic and Spiritual Life, with another large crowd left waiting outside.

Hundreds have digital say on how they manage their health and wellbeing. Last year Healthier Lancashire and South Cumbria asked the Healthwatch Collaborative to help them find out what local people think about using digital technology to manage their health and wellbeing. Almost 2,000 people got involved in the conversation about digital health. Healthwatch have now published the resulting ‘Have your say: digital health’ report. The aim of the project was to explore how local people currently use technology to manage their health and wellbeing – and that of their families and those they support or care for.

How will fuel prices and driving in Europe be affected by Brexit? Following the momentous decision taken today by United Kingdom voters to leave the European Union, a British motoring association has warned fuel prices, driving in Europe and motor insurance could all be affected. The Automobile Association (AA) has said fuel prices are set to rise during a period of instability as the market begins to adjust to the news that Britons have voted to leave the EU. Driving abroad will also change, with drivers having to display a GB sign with the potential of a fine for those that don’t.

Johnston said Hollingsworth’s daughter and four children were living with him, and he took the daughter to work, paid for child care and drove the grandchildren to day care or school.

After seven seasons together with the Cubs , could the Theo Trio be on the verge of a breakup ? Theo has been with the Cubs for nine years now, and while there’s always a lot that goes on behind the scenes and between the two of them, there’s always a lot of love and support behind them. While some Cubs fans have long been critical of the Theo Trio, and have been on record saying that Theo didn’t care for their presence on the team, there’s never been any bad blood between them.

Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi routinely lands up at the airport to receive world dignitaries. From the moment a world leader sets foot on Indian soil, Modi's photo ops begin. Who can forget the famous Modi hug reserved for world leaders? Modi's Canadian counterpart, Trudeau, is equally an ace at producing visuals of himself doing things. When they landed in New Delhi on February 17 on the beginning of the Canadian prime minister's week-long trip to the country, the Trudeaus came out of the plane with a namaste, the traditional Indian greeting. But Modi wasn't there to receive them.

Richard Swift , singer-songwriter , musician and the second son of actor Richard Swift , was an American singer-songwriter, guitarist, multi-instrumentalist, music publisher, record producer, and recording artist. Ellen Lucas has been running the Carson Nugget Nevada Day Classic for longer than she cares to remember. The Gardnerville runner decided to try something different Saturday and wound up with a new course record. Lucas, 47, finished as the first woman overall in the Carson City 8-kilometer race and set a course masters women’s record with a time of 32 minutes, 47 seconds. Her time broke the old course standard of 33:19 set by Jackie Taylor in 1999. Brett Long was the overall winner in a men’s course record of 26:35 and Gregorio Castro edged defending race champion and training partner Agustin Arroy for second-place.

The new law finishes old business in Trenton and expands the so-called Tuition Equality Act, which let qualified immigrants pay in-state tuition. Going to college is not cheap these days. In fact, for many in New Jersey, it is unaffordable. Gov. Phil Murphy’s signing into law a bill that allows undocumented immigrants to apply for state financial aid to help pay for college beginning this fall won’t help all who hope to attend a post-secondary school, but it could help many. With Murphy’s signing, New Jersey becomes the 10th state to extend financial aid to undocumented college students.

SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — A pair of Buckeyes were doing their best to hold off a team with five majors between them at the Liberty Mutual Legends of Golf. John Cook and Joey Sindelar, who have known each other since their college days at Ohio State, shot a better-ball 10-under 62 on Friday to share the first-round lead with Mark O'Meara and Nick Price in the Champions Tour event. Fred Couples, a three-time winner in five starts on the 50-and-over tour, and Jay Haas were a stroke back along with Blaine McCallister-Bob Tway and Brad Bryant-Lonnie Nielson.

Two tech executives played the role of superhero Thursday morning when they thwarted a man's alleged attempt to steal a drone and a remote-control helicopter from a San Francisco Radio Shack. According to CBS San Francisco, a man allegedly entered the Polk Street store at around 10 a.m., grabbed the drone and helicopter, then ran out. Greg Forrest, president and CEO of software company Greenhawk Financial Services, was in the store at the time. He reportedly chased the thief out of the store and engaged him in a fist fight. "Punches and pushing and everything else," Forrest said to CBS.

OAKLAND — Nine people living in East Oakland discovered over the past nine months what it ” s like to eat” in the face of a growing food shortage. The residents of East Oakland, who were told in March by a city agency that food would arrive only in August, said they did not buy the food in April, when the agency did deliver. They were not told to expect it to arrive in August. The residents of East Oakland are one of several groups of people who are suffering through the worst food crisis in state history.

A year ago, Palos Verdes came on strong at the end of the regular season and dominated during the playoffs en route to winning the Northern Division championship. The Sea Kings are doing it again. They could easily be 9-0 but final-minute losses to Narbonne and Newport Harbor have them at 7-2 and they are ranked No. 1 in this week's Northern Division rankings. A win over Peninsula on Friday will give Palos Verdes another Bay League championship. The team once again relies on a variety of players. Running back Tyler Moore is closing in on 1,000 yards rushing and has 15 touchdowns.

A jaunt through October's art highlights. Eighty-eight-year-old Jack McLarty has had a distinguished career, with an exhibition history stretching back to the 1940s and artworks housed in collections such as the Smithsonian Institution's. His paintings this month at Broderick show evidence of his fascination with Central and South America. A riot of tropicalia, The Garden of Good and Evil is all parrots, crucifixes, Dia de los Muertos skulls and anacondas wrapped around naked women's legs. The best of McLarty's works have a kooky exuberance, executed with a neo-Impressionist technique and a folk artist's naivetÉ.

We chose to question the narrative of history by simply quoting words which Churchill used himself . At a glance it looks as if Churchill was referring only to the need to continue the war effort. I would point out that he said,

"There is one thing I do not want you to think I am giving up, however long it takes; but I am determined, whatever the cost, to win the war. We shall have to face the fact, however much you may want me to give up and however much we may disagree about how to do it."'

WASHINGTON – Congress is moving to put under military control all armed contractors operating in combat zones , a Pentagon official said Wednesday. The move, announced on Wednesday by House Armed Services Committee Chairman Rep. John L. Mica of Florida and a House panel of three members, is aimed at reducing U.S. reliance on private military companies operating outside U.S. military bases. The new legislation calls for the U.S. to be able to deny the use of armed contract forces on U.S. soil and bars U.S. officials from allowing armed private military companies to conduct combat operations outside military bases.

ROBIN VAN PERSIE may still leave Manchester United this summer, but it won't be for Qatari side Lekhwiya according to general secretary Adnan Ali. Van Persie's United future remains up in the air with reports suggesting the Dutch striker could be sold this summer. Louis van Gaal refused to clarify Van Persie's future over the weekend, leading to further speculation that the former Arsenal man could be on his way. There's no truth in the news. It had been claimed that Lekhwiya - currently coached by former Swansea boss Michael Laudrup - had put together a £6m-a-year package to lure Van Persie to Qatar.

BUHLER - The south wall of Jim Baker Fieldhouse is considered hallowed ground at Buhler High . It 's reserved by the school for a special class of students - students who have overcome physical and emotional obstacles to find their way to college or success. This is what a Buhler football player looked like in the spring of 2005. Jim Baker Field is located at the intersection of Buhler Road and Main Street just down the road from the high school where Buhler football players attend. It is a large, open-air facility with bleachers on both sides of the high school's field.

Weld District Attorney Ken Buck ’ s U.S. Senate bid is reportedly coming to an end . Sources have told Fox News that Senator Buck has decided to drop out of the U.S. Senate race against Democrat Doug Jones . Buck is the first Democrat senator to announce a run for President in 2016. According to the sources, he will not be running for reelection in the U.S. Senate . Buck will enter the race as the Republican nominee . Buck is the state treasurer for the state of Georgia and is also the president of the Georgia Public Policy Foundation .

Today marks the 314th anniversary of the last Cascadia Subduction Zone earthquake . Geological records indicate that this 9.0 magnitude event occurred on August 27, 1923. A massive tsunami caused devastating damage and destroyed some coastal communities in Puget Sound and Washington’s Eastern shore, including Seattle and Tacoma, Washington. This devastating earthquake was one of the worst in American history. For decades, it was a mystery why the Puget Sound region was spared the wrath of this powerful earthquake. Several theories have suggested that the earthquake was “locked” within the Pacific Northwest.

A Houston district court judge who lost a re-election bid on Tuesday is facing criticism for releasing a majority of his campaign emails under the state's Freedom of Access to Records Act. The Texas Supreme Court has the final say on the matter, and has not ruled yet. But in a 5-4 opinion released on Tuesday, it did not agree with a judge's assertion that releasing the emails in the public interest would violate campaign finance laws. The lower court's ruling is being appealed to the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals, which also will have final say.

An injury at work left a husband and father facing a layoff. He couldn't return to the job until his hand healed from surgery, but recovery was complicated by an ongoing struggle with diabetes. With two children in the home, the family saved enough to pay the power bill. Unfortunately, that left very little money for rent. The Clarke County School District contacted the Empty Stocking Fund for help on the family's behalf. A check was written for a portion of the rent in an effort to keep the family in their home.

MASSENA – Mr. William V. Cameron , Jr. , 62 , a resident of Olympia , Washington and a 1977 member of the state board, was elected to serve a one-year term as President pro tempore of the United States House of Representatives Tuesday, Sept. 6, 2013. Mr. Cameron is the son of William V. , Sr. who served three terms on the Washington state senate prior to being elected to the House. He has lived in Massena since 1977. He has earned a B.S., with a major in political science and an associate degree in accounting.

Two capitals are look set to burst through the 40C mark and another swelters through its 10th day of a heatwave. Melbourne is set to hit 42C today, a figure a climate expert has called a once in a decade heat event. Adelaide’s CBD has seen temperatures soar to 41C on Thursday as south eastern Australia sweats its way through 36 hours of “intense heat”. At 2.30pm Adelaide’s CBD reached its forecast high for the day and is likley to keep on climbing. Further inland, Port Augusta touched 44.7C, Ceduna 45.5C and Nullabor 46.2C at 1.40pm.

BAMAKO, Mali – The head of an ethnic Dogon militia blamed for a massacre in central Mali is denying that his fighters were involved in the gruesome attack. Youssouf Toloba also dismissed the Malian president's vow to eliminate the group, because "he isn't the one who created it." Human Rights Watch has said that Toloba's ethnic militia known as Dan Na Ambassagou has been implicated in scores of attacks in recent months. Suspicion immediately fell on the group when at least 134 people were slain over the weekend in an ethnic Peulh village.

When Pacers coach Frank Vogel announced he would sit all five starters for last night 's game against the Bucks, many questioned the decision and the need for the bench. As we’ve pointed out before, with Vogel leading a team that has made it to three straight playoff appearances, he may not need to rely on his bench, as he’s had the personnel to make the Pacers a threat. Yet, it can be difficult to know when you’ll need to rely on someone on the bench to get things done.

The percentage of overweight and obese adults in Lancashire is almost 1% higher than the national average (64.7% compared to 63.8%). The first annual report produced by Lancashire’s Director of Public Health has highlighted the fact that while people are living longer, they are often facing years of ill-health at the end of their lives. • While people are generally living longer, life expectancy and the number of years for which people enjoy good health in Lancashire are less than the national average. • Work to address health inequalities is needed both in deprived communities and more affluent ones.

Richard Swift Obituary: Richard Swift’s Obituary by the TheTimesNews.com. Richard Swift, singer-songwriter, musician and producer who worked with the Shins and many others, has died at the age of 41, according to multiple news sources. The sad news was announced in a Facebook post and it was confirmed to Pitchfork and other media outlets. No cause of death was given. In June, a GoFundMe campaign was started to help Swift with medical costs for an undisclosed life threatening medical condition. The battle over the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s new “borrower education tool” unveiled earlier this week is heating up, with the National Association of Mortgage Bankers now joining the Mortgage Bankers Association in calling on the CFPB to take the “Rate Checker” online tool down. The CFPB’s new interactive page has come under fire because it mentions rates and costs without including disclosure items that TILA-RESPA rules mandate for borrowers – annual percentage rate, closing fees, etc. “This tool will do nothing but confuse consumers in their shopping experience,” said John Councilman, president of NAMB.

ANTIOCH 6/5/16 – When Trevor Dunning first entered the Trinity Christian School speech class, he was personally greeted, as each student was, and a few words of welcome were exchanged. He stood out with his solid physique, and soft intense face. However, the moment he spoke, his struggles became obvious. While talking, he would suddenly push out a breathy deep, "UHH...UHH," which came every three of four words. It was a severe stutter problem. He had enrolled in my speech class to hopefully be able to speak better.

An extra $190,000 in state special education reimbursement funding that came in late last month has helped the town pay off its nearly half million-dollar settlement with the district's bus drivers union, officials said this week. Together with around $300,000 in savings found in the district's fiscal 2011 budget, the money has covered the town's $497,000 obligation to the drivers, whose jobs have been outsourced to a private busing company. The additional special education money, part of the state's circuit breaker program, will prevent the town from having to carry the debt over into fiscal 2012, officials said.

ROCHESTER – Nathan Bastian scored the game-winning goal as the Binghamton Devils defeated the Rochester Americans in overtime , 4-3, on Saturday afternoon in Game 4 of the best-of-7 American Hockey League Eastern Conference quarterfinals. After falling behind 3-1 in the first period, the Devils came back to tie things up in the final minute of the second frame, as Nick Spaling made a beautiful save to keep the tying goal alive for the home team. With the game tied, Bastian, who had a pair of assists, then scored the winning goal to put the Devils in front once again.

WASHINGTON — House Democrats on Friday unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package that targets what they call a “culture of corruption in Washington” and aims to reduce the role of money in politics. The bill, among the first to be considered as Democrats take control of the House after eight years, would make it easier for citizens to register and vote, tighten election security and require presidents to disclose their tax returns. Dubbed the “For the People Act,” the legislation marks an effort by Democrats to set a tone of good government as they take the majority following historic gains in the midterm elections.

America is voting Tuesday to fill the country's top job opening. The country also has over five million other jobs waiting for the right candidate. The Labor Department said Tuesday that America had 5.5 million job openings in September, close to the record high of 5.8 million openings set in April. There was even a small increase in federal government job openings. It's a great sign that employers want to hire. However, this huge number of openings also signals that employers can't find the workers with the right skills for the open jobs that they have.

The ease of Manchester United ’ s win over Premier League title rivals Chelsea masked a potential moment of controversy for both clubs in the Premier League’s biggest game of the season on the back of one of the best performances in the competition. United’s 4-0 win over the Blues was one of their best results since Jose Mourinho took charge and it was their fourth consecutive victory in all competitions this season. Their victory was the fourth consecutive league victory over their rivals since Mourinho’s return and their sixth in total in the Premier League.

The Fox Sports commentary team covering an Australian Boomers basketball game have been left in a state of shock after an all-in brawl played out live on air. Matt Russell and Aussie basketball legend Shane Heal were calling the game between the Boomers and the Philippines in Bulacan last night, when a scuffle between two players from the opposing teams led to punches, kicks and chairs being thrown as the fight escalated. Both Russell and Heal were in disbelief as the wild scenes involving players, officials and fans played out in front of the TV cameras.

Tropical Storm Selma made landfall on the coast of El Salvador on Saturday with strong winds , heavy rains and torrential downpours. The storm is currently moving south-westwards at 1.3 metres per second. The strongest of the system, a tropical depression, is forecast to move over land on Friday, while a low pressure system is also expected to form in the northern Caribbean. As of Saturday morning, the depression had weakened to a low-level tropical depression as it moves through the Central American coastline. It is forecast to strengthen again before moving into the western Caribbean late on Monday.

China began three days of national mourning for the victims of the May 12 earthquake , restricting access to entertainment sites and closing cinemas in an effort to minimize the disruption to the economy and the general public. The quake's intensity of 6.4 on the moment magnitude scale made it the most powerful in recorded history, according to the U.S. Geological Survey, and made it the largest to strike the East China Sea, according to Japanese seismologists at Japan's Institute of Geophysicists. It destroyed buildings as far as 4,000 km (2,100 miles) away, the researchers said.

TOKYO ( Reuters ) - Japan on Wednesday basked in the glow of its World Cup soccer team ’ s triumph as the country’s football federation (FIFA) praised its team for its performance at the World Cup tournament, which ends in June, saying the team ’ s ‘ “extraordinary” play” helped boost Japan ’ s status as a world power. The Scimitar-horned Oryx no longer lives in the African desert . It is considered extinct in the wild . But, there is another wild animal, the Scimitar-horned Oryx living in a cave in the United States. A pair of Scimitar horned oryx are still alive. This species of Oryx is one of only three species of the genus Oryx (the others being the Eastern Scimitar and the American Horned Oryx ) that can be found in North America, South America, and South Africa. The two species of scimitar horned Oryx live together in the North American Scimitar Fauna.

Jill McGown, who has died aged 59 from cancer, was one of the generation of crime writers who shifted the genre firmly into the contemporary world. Although she held fast to the traditional skill of well-crafted plots, she brought a modern perspective to characters and situations, creating a series of thoughtful and engaging police procedurals. She will be best remembered for the 13 novels featuring Chief Inspector Danny Lloyd and Sergeant Judy Hill. Theirs was a relationship that encompassed the personal as well as the professional, and Jill's deft handling of its development was one of the keynote elements of the books.

TOPEKA ( AP ) - A bill that would rescind restrictions on the development of private property near historical sites in the nation’s capital won unanimous approval Monday from a Kansas City-area committee. The bill’s sponsor, Sen. Tom Brandt, a Republican who represents the state’s Second District, won the approval by a margin of 60-36. Brandi, whose district includes the state’s capitol and most of the Kansas City suburbs, said the proposal, which he hopes to be heard in the Republican-controlled Legislature, is a long-overdue step in addressing historical sites that should be preserved for the benefit of everyone.

A violent thug has been jailed after he unleashed his American pitbull dog on a man who died six days later. A man from the Caribbean was attacked by “a dog of such savagery that it is not safe to be left in the streets” in the early hours of December 1. The dog, which police later described as a large Pitbull terrier, began attacking him outside his house in St James, south west London. The victim was found on December 7 by his daughter who called the emergency services. Video footage shows the man pleading with the dog to stop as she runs up to the terrified animal.

Is a roving, body-scanning van a needed surveillance tool or a another step toward eroding personal privacy? Andy Greenberg of Forbes is reporting that American Science & Engineering, which provides x-ray scanners to governments and defense companies, has introduced a van capable of scanning nearby cars. The Z Backscatter Vans, or ZBVs, are used to scan for explosives, drugs and people, making them an ideal tool for security, law enforcement and border control agencies. The vans work by emitting low-level x-rays off and through nearby objects to collect a visual snapshot of other vehicles.

A Manitoba woman has been sent to prison for hiding the remains of six infants in a rented storage locker in a downtown apartment, a new court document shows. Nancy M. Tully was sentenced to eight years, eight months in prison last Thursday. She was convicted on two counts each of second-degree fraud and second-degree conspiracy to commit fraud. "I just want to say that I love you and thank you for everything you are doing to help families and children," said Tully at the sentencing hearing.

If you live along the Eastern Seaboard and wake up early Friday you could be treated to a colorful sky hours before sunrise lights up the horizon. The Terrier-Improved Malumute sounding rocket is scheduled for launch Friday between 4:26 a.m. and 4:41 a.m. ET. Sounding rockets, by the way, have been used for over 40 years to carry science payloads on brief, 5-20 minute missions to space. Friday morning should provide mostly clear skies in the viewing location, and upper level winds should be friendly enough to allow the launch to take place (if not, backup launch dates are available each morning through June 6).

The percentage of overweight and obese adults in Lancashire is almost 1 % higher than the national average ( 64.7% and 47.3% respectively) and 1.9% higher than the UK average (55.5%) for adults. The level of obesity among women is almost 5 times higher than men. This is higher than the national average (32.6% of women and 16.6% of men) and 2 times the UK average (17.6% and 8.9% respectively). In Lancashire, 20.5% of the overweight and obese population are aged 18-34 years.

Sanday , a Scottish island inhabited by only six people , has just got its first road – an unpaved road that will cut the island off from mainland Britain . But it hasn’t just got off the island. It’s got a whole bunch of cars, vans, trucks, buses, lorries, trains, bikes, pedestrians and cyclists on it as it crawls over the hills and tumbles around the narrow valleys into the sea. Now that’s something you might think would be impossible, but it isn’t. And the island itself is not the problem.

PARIS -- France could become the latest country to ban the use of underweight fashion models . France 's health minister launched the proposal Wednesday during a news conference in which he called for greater use of the country 's food-inspection powers to ban the use of underweight models and their clothes. The proposal comes as France 's government faces intense criticism from France 's leading fashion retailers, who argue that models are not fit for purpose -- particularly for modeling. "They have a high fat content and that's why the model is underweight.

The casino chain's stock moved higher as the company announced new expansion plans. A rendering of Paradise Park. Image source: Wynn Resorts, Ltd.
What: Shares of Wynn Resorts, Limited (NASDAQ:WYNN) were in the money today, gaining 10% as of 11:04 a.m. ET after the company announced expansion plans and an analyst upgrade. So what: The casino operator last night presented plans for a new 1,000-room resort on a lake in Las Vegas, tentatively called Wynn Paradise Park. The resort would be the only lakeside destination of its kind in the gambling capital.

Oh , how the mighty ’ do has fallen ! Disgraced former senator and presidential candidate John Edwards , reviled during last week’s campaign as a “radical” with an “unconscionable past”, has lost his position as a candidate for president. He is now in jail awaiting trial on charges of sexual assault, and is being held at Folsom prison. Edwards, now in his seventies, had been seen as a possible candidate to challenge President Obama’s presidency, and perhaps even the incumbent party’s establishment.

How will fuel prices and driving in Europe be affected by Brexit ? Following the momentous decision taken today by the UK Parliament, we asked a leading expert on European transport for a response. We are very grateful to her for this opportunity to hear from her expert views on the implications for the fuel price and driving in EU member states if the UK crashes out of the EU before a trade deal can be concluded in December 2020. This expert is Professor Jens-Peter Eriksson of the KTH Royal Institute for Technology in Stockholm and is one of the most well known experts in the field of fuel prices and driving in Europe.

Most Janus cats do n't live for more than a few days , but Frank and Louie 's unusually long life spanned several years. But, in the end , Louie was not to be so lucky. He lost his battle with cancer over two years ago now, and has had to spend the majority of his life in the hospital. Louie was hospitalized a number of times for different health issues and has always had a very difficult time making it from one room to another, but this time, he was too weak to go into the hospital .

A FAKE doctor allegedly used useless metal rods to test people for cancer and diabetes then charged a fortune to find out the truth. It’s no wonder so many patients are so desperate for proof. This week, a fake doctor charged patients £500 to “investigate” whether they were a risk for cancer and diabetes – and charge patients £500 to get a report from the bogus doctor’s boss, who would also send a bill to the doctor. The fake doctor, whose identity was stolen by cyber crime, even told his bosses to make sure he had enough money for the bogus report.

The PS4 is launching with a versatile set of games today , but that doesn ’ t mean Sony wants you to play their games without a PS3 controller or two. After the announcement that PlayStation 4 will be the new home console to grace the living room, we’ve been wondering what the first games on the new system will be. In the video below, we’ve got a look at a couple of games that are already slated to make the jump to the PS4 – and we’ve included some extra gameplay footage to prove just how good Sony’s new console really is.

In true Colorado fashion , Fort Collins ' first full week of spring will bring below-freezing temperatures on the heels of a recent record low of -13°F in April. This is the coldest April since the National Weather Service was started to keep a running tally in 1883. "I can't wait to get back inside and do some gardening and get in a little bit of walking. I've got lots of stuff I want to take out to the neighborhood." For the second week in a row, Fort Collins received a below-freezing 0°F, the lowest of the three winters in the area that have been recorded.

The newest entry to the robo-advisory service is TIAA. Part of the allure for firms is to appeal to Millennials, now the nation's largest generation. The Wall Street trend of using financially savvy robots to help investors build portfolios online with a few mouse clicks has another convert. TIAA is the latest entrant into the robo-advisery business, which lets investors create a professionally managed personal account online in minutes without human intervention. As technology becomes a bigger part of daily life and more investors manage their money digitally, financial firms have pushed to provide online investing solutions, which has led to a proliferation of robo-driven services.

One person died and 8,469 people were affected in torrential rains that prevails in Galle from Saturday evening , Galle and surrounding area have seen heavy rains for over 40 hours and more than 1000mm of water is still pouring down in Galle, Limassol and other major cities in the province. Galle, a town in the province of Antalya has been under water since Saturday evening as the city is a major tourist destination for the country. There are more than 20,000 people living in Galle, mainly living in slums on the hillside and many families are trying to escape the situation by buying boats and rafts.

There were two dividing impulses in Robin Williams 's performances that could , roughly , be called his American and British periods. His British period was in the 1960s - the period when he began his transformation into a more popular star as a child actor and, with his first hit film The Little Mermaid, his first American period was in the 1970s. His American period began in the 1980s and his British period in the late 1970s and early '80s. Williams himself said it was a difficult time. He was still trying to figure out what to do for his career and was struggling with his acting.

Until further guidance is issued, USCIS is temporarily applying interim procedures to H-1B non-profit entity petitions filed with the agency seeking an exemption from the statutory H-1B numerical cap based on an affiliation with or relation to an institution of higher education, an official announcement said. Effective immediately, during this interim period USCIS will give deference to prior determinations made since June 6, 2006, that a non-profit entity is related to or affiliated with an institution of higher education – absent any significant change in circumstances or clear error in the prior adjudication – and, therefore, exempt from the H-1B statutory cap.

Other events add to the excitement . They , too , are a lot of work . But they add excitement . They are an extra reason to come out of the dark for the evening . But when it is done and dusted and put away . I find a new reason to be out there . I have to admit . . I love to walk to a new neighborhood . And when the neighborhood is a little more open . It seems that this time I am in it . It is good . I am very very happy . This is where the neighborhood was when I was in my twenties .

How to stay on track , get ahead , study abroad or pursue a special interest . Enroll in any of the University of Michigan courses to earn your degree and prepare for your dream job . You can earn your degree at the University of Michigan, but some students opt to study abroad to experience the different cultures and countries around the world . Some students also pursue a career in business and finance . Michigan offers several different degrees and careers. Some of the majors you might consider are Marketing , Accounting , Finance , Business Administration , Mechanical Engineering , Computer Science and more .

Minister for Enterprise and Commerce, Max Bradford, today rejected claims by the Engineers Union that jobs created by the Employment Contracts Act are predominantly casual, part-time and low-paid. "The ECA is the most successful piece of industrial relations legislation in New Zealand's history and attempts by the Secretary of the Engineers Union, to brand it as a failure are laughable", said Mr Bradford. "The success of the ECA sticks in the throat of Unions, because it has delivered what they couldn't: more jobs and higher wages.  industrial disputes have fallen to their lowest level since 1935.

Have you heard the latest uproar? Of course you haven't - it's too loud. So say some residents who frequent downtown. Others say the bluster is louder than any motorcycle exhaust pipe. We say everyone should turn down the volume on complaining and let people go about their own business downtown. Also, let the police do their job. There is already a downtown noise ordinance in place, and the police reported to the city Tuesday that new measures are coming. First, the bikers.

DUTA has been boycotting the evaluation for a month now to protest the new faculty reservation mechanism in universities and to keep its voice strong. As of today, DUTA will no longer be accepting new applications, and it will not renew any existing applications. If you are applying to be a faculty member at any university, DUTA is making you aware of these changes. To get the latest information about DUTA’s status as a member of the faculty and to apply for faculty jobs in the USA, visit the website http://duta.us/ or send a mail to info@dutalumni.org.

Newly anointed McDonald's CEO Donald Thompson gets some perks with his fries. A Big Mac may only cost a few dollars at McDonald’s, but when it comes to the fast food chain’s Big Mac Special Sauce, things get pricey fast. McDonald’s Australia has apparently decided to auction off the first of 200 bottles of their “legendary” sauce on eBay and bidders are emptying more than just their pockets for a chance to purchase the limited-edition bottle. By Tuesday morning bids had reached nearly $18,000 with more than seven days left to bid.

A 29-year-old woman was killed when her car was hit by a train on a crossing in Ogi, Saga Prefecture, police said Sunday. According to police, the incident occurred at around 5:50 p.m. Saturday on a crossing on the JR Nagasaki Line near Kubota Station. Fuji TV reported that the driver of the car, Miki Fukuzaki, was taken to hospital with extensive injuries but died about two hours later. Police quoted the driver of the train as saying he saw the car on the crossing and applied the emergency brake but couldn’t stop in time.

Shares in Premier Foods shot up five per cent earlier today after the Mr Kipling and Hovis group said it is interested in making a deal. In response, the company said: "We have been approached by Hovis & Co Ltd to explore the possibility of a tie-up with us, but our view on the matter is that, while there are elements of the food market where we do well, for the next couple of years it would be better if we continue to look at the commercial opportunities on an all-round basis."

After delivering a blockbuster such as Meri Gurriya, writer Radain Shah is on a roll as her story explores polarities in a society with double-standards. Trouble knows no bounds when a lively, emancipated, jeans-clad Uswa (Ramsha Khan) — who has male friends and comes home at all hours because her family gives her the trust and space — succumbs to immense family pressure and marries Hannan (Shehzad Sheikh), born and bred in a conservative family set-up. To top it all he has massive anger issues. Uswa’s abaya-wearing repressive mum-in-law (Asma Abbas) calls the shots in Uswa’s new home.

The 2014 Chevrolet Camaro Z28. DETROIT — General Motors is recalling more cars for problems with ignition switches. GM is recalling nearly 512,000 Chevrolet Camaro muscle cars from the 2010 to 2014 model years. A driver's knee can bump the key and knock the switch out of the "run" position, causing an engine stall. That knocks out power steering and brakes and could cause drivers to lose control. GM said it knows of three crashes and four minor injuries from the problem. The company added that the Camaro switches met its specifications, unlike the switches at the center of a recall of 2.6 million small cars.

U.S. President Donald Trump attends a swearing in ceremony for senior staff at the White House in Washington, DC January 22, 2017. BEIJING (Reuters) - The new U.S. administration must fully understand the importance of the "one China" policy and appreciate that the issue of Taiwan is highly sensitive for the Beijing government, China said on Monday. U.S. President Donald Trump, who was inaugurated on Friday, said in December the United States did not necessarily have to stick to its long-standing position that Taiwan is part of "oneChina".

No doubt if you are into painting of the artistic kind then you will probably know that artist Thomas Kinkade passed away last Friday, and although an autopsy has been completed, it appears that an announcement as to the cause of Kinkade’s death could be weeks away, as the Santa Clara County coroner is awaiting results of tests before deciding on the cause of death. However, according to the LA Times, the artist’s family attribute the painter’s death to natural causes, but this will be determined by the coroner.

Timeshare management companies foreclose on homeowners who do not pay the bill . 1 Can I Be Sued for Not Paying the Hosted Internet Service Bill? If You’re Going to Make It So Complicated, Make It Simple . . . How do I Know If I’m Charging Too High? How Do I Know if My ISP Will Stop Calling My Cell Phone and Will Ask For a Fee? What If I Have An Unmetered DSL Service? These are questions that I get asked all too often when I ask people about their service.

The Nicholls softball team staged a strong defensive effort Wednesday night against Southern Mississippi in its home opener at Swanner Field in Thibodaux. Nicholls State stifled the Golden Eagles at the plate, while taking advantage of three errors in the 4-1 non-conference victory. Colonels pitcher Megan Landry earned the win with four strikeouts, a walk and by scattering three hits in six innings. Southern Miss pitcher Abby Trahan took the loss despite six strikeouts, two walks and allowing five hits. "It was a bit of a chess match in the beginning," Colonels coach Angel Santiago said.

CBS President and CEO Les Moonves has pushed for rights to stream NFL games on the network's digital service. CBS Corp. said it obtained rights to carry National Football League games on its CBS All Access streaming service, allowing the most-watched U.S. TV network to offer its most popular programming online. The multiyear deal with the NFL begins Sunday and will include all CBS coverage of regular, preseason and post-season games in subscribers’ local markets, the network said Thursday in a statement. Financial terms weren’t disclosed. While NFL viewership has declined this year, football remains the most popular programming on TV.

Carrying-case manufacturer Skooba announced Thursday that it's working with the Transportation Security Administration on new laptop bags that can pass through airport security without having the computer inside removed. Carrying-case manufacturer Skooba--the same company that brought the world the slightly mocking Skreener bag --announced Thursday that it's working with the Transportation Security Administration on new laptop bags that can pass through airport security without having the computer inside removed. "If all goes well, this will be very welcome news for many tech-travelers.," the company stated in a release issued today.

I was delighted to read in Eureka Street Ruby Hamad ’ s passionate protest that she and other Muslims should be arrested. This was followed immediately by a call from a leading American Muslim woman to arrest the Muslim Mayor of Seattle. As I read more of her article, I became aware of just how many other American Muslims were joining in the protest as well, even though it seemed that the problem was not with Seattle or its Muslim leadership. This is the first time I have seen an American Muslim call to arrest a public official as a protest against American Muslim leaders.

Why Did This Woman Walk Away From Earning $ 600,000 ? It takes a lot of courage to quit your job, a lot of money, and quit your home. In the meantime, you can get a $ 2,000 a month job at a nonprofit organization, but you don’t get to live in that house. What’s next? A $ 50,000 a year home with a mortgage? You don’t think it is that hard to quit? No, I’m not a millionaire, but I have $ 1.2 million.

GoldMoney founder James Turk interviews When Money Dies author Adam Fergusson , who discusses the parallels and differences between the money printing scheme of 1913 and the gold-based fiat monetary system which we have now. The interview was recorded and can be downloaded in MP3, MP4, and WAV format. You can also listen in the audio player above, by clicking the link. There is a podcast link to the audio podcast embedded on the main page. Adam: I’ve been keeping up with your articles on Money & Markets for several years. What was your first article about?

Where do we begin to try to describe this restaurant? Probably the best place is first to apologize for keeping this secret to ourselves for such a long time. We have agonized over whether to publicize this jewel, and have finally decided it really is our responsibility to share this fantastic place with you. So what makes this such a special find? After all, there are some delightful restaurants in Bratislava, and this gastronomic oasis is 140 kilometers away. Why should we encourage you to take this drive? Simply, it is a combination of the people, the food, and the service.

In a study from 24/7 Wall Street, Leelanau County was named Michigan's most expensive housing market with a median home price of $281,979. To find Michigan's most expensive housing market, you'll need to look to Michigan's northern Lower Peninsula — and the home of Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore. Leelanau County is home to 26 wineries, the coastal village of Suttons Bay and a substantial portion of Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore. The picturesque M-22 also runs along the peninsula's shoreline. The median mortgage payment in Leelanau County is $1,140 with a median household income of $59,018.

The police have uncovered Class A drugs after using its powers of stop-and-search in Central Park . Arrests were made at the end of July in the presence of a member of parliament, it was reported. "This is not a search - this is a police operation." As a result the city's police force was forced to launch a new policy in which they were expected to only stop, question and speak to people if they were carrying anything illegal, rather than being authorised to search and search the whole of an area for any reason, or to seize a suspect's property for no apparent reason.

Boulder has sued the fossil fuel companies. Probably 15 percent or so of us would be alive today without fossil fuels since without them we would be living in the Middle Ages without medicines, electricity, real sanitation, etc. Those of us who did not die in childbirth or by an infection caused by a scratch could enjoy living a short life behind an animal pulling a wooden plow. Maybe it would be best if we recognize that fossil fuels had their role, evolve our power supplies to renewable, storable resources, and stop demonizing everyone.

An online portal aimed at ensuring that the Muslim community gets religious knowledge from recognised sources was launched yesterday by Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz, the largest party in Pakistan's parliament, as a response to the government's recent decision to block access of social media sites including Facebook and Twitter to any news, views and content from the government. Earlier in May, the Supreme Court dismissed a Pmln petition seeking its review over a decision by the government's Information Commission, in which the commission had barred Facebook from hosting a website created by the Commission.

China began three days of national mourning for the victims of the May 12 earthquake, restricting access to entertainment content both on the Internet and broadcast media. The official English-language newspaper China Daily reported Monday that "All public amusements will be suspended for three days from Monday. The State Council, the Cabinet, on Sunday ordered a nationwide display of respect for the dead." Major portals Sina.com and Sohu.com limited their home page offerings to news content. Sohu adopted an all-black font, with most of the links on the top half of the page relating to earthquake news.

Although there’s long been a debate over the accuracy of health information online, many U.S. Internet users aren’t hesitant to use the Web when they want answers to health-related questions. And rather than dedicated health sites, the vast majority of them begin their research at a search engine. A new study out tonight from the Pew Research Center’s Internet & American Life Project says that 72 percent of U.S. Internet users have gone online in the past year specifically for health-related information, and 77 percent of that group says their research started at Google, Bing or another general search engine.

Black Starlets coach Samuel Fabin says his side were not threatened at any point in their convincing win over India, and he is confident the match will go ahead as scheduled. Fabin has no idea whether his side will be named as the third-placed team on Wednesday evening but he knows his players have to be on their best behaviour if they have any hopes of winning a major tournament. “What we want to do is put ourselves on a par with the rest,’’ he said. “I’ve spoken to the captaincy committee and we spoke about that and they were fine with it.

John Bennett(July 20), a teacher at Westside Middle School, was upset by the School Board's decision to have teachers teach all sides of any controversy. He is right, of course, that pretending all sides of any controversy are equally valid is nonsense. But a good deal of the issue hinges on our definition of "teaching" a position. If "teaching" means that the teacher merely presents all sides of a controversy as though they were equal in weight and legitimacy, then we are being equal time indoctrinists.

The F-35 Lightning II is the most powerful fighter in our arsenal today and the first U.S. fighter to meet the full range of specifications and capabilities that will define future aircraft. It is being delivered by Lockheed Martin, and features advanced stealth technology, advanced electronics, a powerful engine, state-of-the-art sensor systems, and highly-integrated mission systems.

Ryanair has lowered its full year profit guidance from a current range of €1.25-€1.35 billion to a new range of €1.10-€1.20 billion. The decision, which saw shares in the airline fall by more than ten per cent, comes after a turbulent period for the low-cost carrier. The Irish airline was recently hit by a fall in traffic after pilots and cabin crew in Germany, Holland, Belgium, Spain and Portugal went on strike. Ryanair has also been forced to lower fares for the third quarter of the year (particularly for the October school half-term holidays and Christmas) as customer confidence has been affected by fear of further strikes.

The movement is a global phenomenon – but here it has stalled before even getting started . RIDESHARING SERVICES WHICH DO NOT REQUIRE A RIDING ACCOUNT HAVE ARRIVED IN THE INDIA OF THE MIDDLE EAST AS THE COUNTRY REACHES ITS 50TH YEAR. Ridesharing is a service offered where the owner of an automobile hires out the service of chauffeurs and drivers in order to get rid of vehicles for a fee. Ridesharing services that do NOT require a riding account have arrived in the Indian country as the country reaches its 50th anniversary, the Times of India reported last night.

The proxy owner and publicity officer of a private event-organising company, who were arrested on charges of organising the Wadduwa beach party where four people died, were today remanded till August 17 by Panadura Additional Magistrate Kalhari Liyanage. The suspects, Amila Pushpakumara and Eranda Danthanarayana were produced in Court by the Wadduwa Police Crime Branch Sub Inspector K.A.S.W. Sugath. Submitting the report on the police investigations, he said the Government Analyst and Assistant Government Analyst visited the hotel and conducted investigations. SI Sigath said the police also carried out an investigation into the tragedy that occurred at the beach party on August 4 attended by some 2,000 people.

After Superman and Mission: Impossible – Fallout, Henry Cavill has landed another highly coveted role. On Tuesday, Netflix announced that the chiseled leading man will be starring in the streaming giant’s adaptation of the beloved Witcher Saga. The 35-year-old actor will be playing Geralt of Rivia, a witcher (or male witch) who travels a mythic land known only as “the Continent” hunting horrifying creatures. Here’s the official synopsis: Based on the best-selling fantasy series, The Witcher is an epic tale of fate and family.

Media & Entertainment I write about women in the business of Hollywood . New research released today from the Geena Davis Institute at UCLA shows that there are at least a dozen more actresses under the age of 35 who have gone to Hollywood to work for one of the major studios. They are not the stereotypical Hollywood princesses of yesteryear - but they have more in common with the type of women you are unlikely to find in a 1950s Hollywood musical than a 1950s Hollywood movie. They are women in the business of Hollywood, not in the film industry.

For three turbulent centuries, the glimpse of a square sail and dragon-headed prow on the horizon struck terror into the hearts of medieval Europeans. Indeed, the Viking Age, from A.D. 800-1100, was the age of the sleek, speedy longship. Without this crucial advance in ship technology, the Vikings would never have become a dominant force in medieval warfare, politics, and trade. With their invention of the longship, the Vikings spurred a literal sea change in medieval European affairs. The drekar, or dragon-headed longships, were stealthy troop-carriers.

Surgical Strike Day: State Education minister Partha Chatterjee yesterday criticised the central government alleging that the UGC's direction on 'Surgical Strike Day' is a part of the BJP's "agenda". Surgical Strike Day: The Narendra Modi government at the Centre and ruling Trinamool Congress dispensation headed by Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee seems to be heading into a fresh rift, this time over the University Grants Commission’s (UGC) directive to varsities on Thursday and higher educational institutions across the country to observe September 29 as “Surgical strike day”.

Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli are making the most of their time in England . The actor recently posted an Instagram story about the “glorious” time he spent learning the game in the run-up to the Champions Trophy, where they will play Pakistan in Sharjah. ‘It is a wonderful experience to play alongside Virat,’ says Anushka. He was inspired by the Indian captain’s performance at the International Twenty20 World Cup in England – ‘an honour for his country, a great success’. And how impressed was Virat over his England counterpart?

Security researchers at Kaspersky Lab say they 've discovered the first virus designed to infect iPods . Called `` Podloso``, it is a Trojan, that is designed to steal data off of iPhones and iPad . The malware is written in Javascript and runs under the user-controlled control of the user, thus giving hackers a lot of power over the iPhone and iPad user. The user is required to pay $20 to the company to get the malware to work, and they are then given a limited amount of access to the device after payment has been made.

SAN FRANCISCO ( MarketWatch ) -- Jennifer Mehaffey was lucky to have enjoyed a seven-month leave to be with and care for her ailing father, but she didn't plan to work as a teacher after her divorce. She had been living in a "fantastic house" with her parents for six months, she says, when she was called one day to work as an English teacher at the University of California San Diego, and told she couldn't work because her father's health was too frail to support her and the family needed some time to make arrangements for her.

Last week , we learned that the Obama administration is considering other alternatives to stop foreclosures . Today , we learned that the administration has decided to use government agencies rather than private banks to assist with the process. What would this mean? Well , it means that foreclosures have been allowed to continue for the most part while the banks were making large profits. Now that they are no longer making as much money, the government is in the process of getting involved in the foreclosure process once again. As we previously wrote , the government already has the power to seize property from people that it deems to be in default.

A cartographer that created maps for senior policy makers at the National Counterterrorism Center wants to map out your next hunt or backpacking trip. Ben Harshyne and his wife Kate Harshyne took a risk this year when Ben left his job as a contractor where he made maps for the National Counterterrorism Center and chose to work full time on a company he started called HUNTERRA Mapping. HUNTERRA creates maps by blending high-resolution aerial photography with a 3D-like terrain model. The company can create waterproof, tear resistant field maps, poster maps and custom-sized mega maps.

Patient is a 36-year-old male who immigrated from southwest Asia three months ago , and now has a pustular pruritic lesions on the extremities. Examination: The patient presented with a 5 cm-sized, erythematous, itchy, pruritic, slightly painful nodule located on the right upper limb. The nodule was present since his arrival in the country and it was initially as a small raised area. After a few days it became a red, itchy, papular lesion. There were no other associated symptoms. The lesion started to increase gradually in size and became larger and larger.

Two cemeteries in Washington County are prime examples of the wealth of history that graveyards can hold -- and the need to preserve their integrity and value. They represent two of the county's wealthiest and most iconic cemeteries. Washington County has more than 100,000 acres of land. Most of those are used for farming and grazing, as well as for hay fields, and for hunting. Washington County's largest cemetery is the Evergreen Cemetery, which was founded in 1883. The cemetery sits on the north end of U.S. 41, with an area of 5 acres.

It's time for an end of an article. And I guess you are one of the first ones who will be reading. I've decided to take off for a few days, and I think that it would be of some interest to you. My plan was to do it over the course of three weeks, and it's still going.

A jaunt through October 's art highlights . Eighty-eight-year-old Jack McLarty has had a distinguished career , with an exhibition at the National Museum of Contemporary Art in Melbourne, as well as numerous other commissions and public art pieces throughout Melbourne, Australia and overseas. In the series "Jack McLarty: A Retrospective," the renowned artist will share a series of new paintings that reflect his career. The paintings are a selection from a large, private collection that includes paintings, sketches, photographs, and personal objects from Jack McLarty's private collection and his extensive travels in the 1960s and 1970s.

New York, NY, March 19, 2014 … In recognition of her “abiding commitment to promoting and protecting human rights at home and abroad,” the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) today presented German Chancellor Angela Merkel with its distinguished ADL Joseph Prize for Human Rights. The prize was presented at the German Chancellery in Berlin by members of a leadership delegation currently traveling in Germany led by Barry Curtiss-Lusher, ADL National Chair and Abraham H. Foxman, ADL National Director. Angela Merkel has been Chancellor of Germany since 2005 and the leader of the Christian Democratic Union since 2000, and is the first woman to hold either office.

Perhaps the most ironic and scary part of the whole “ Thank You ” rally was the crowd ’ s chant “ we need a police chief ”

This year the “ police chief ” chant was used by Occupy activists to express the anger and rage they felt at the actions of police. This year the chants also came to symbolize Occupy protests. The chant of police chiefs is actually quite common in protest songs, and usually means to ask that they be replaced by the people who actually are in charge. Many protesters chant “ we need a new police chief ”, however there are exceptions to this.

Christmas Dining Chicago 2010: Ten Chicago-centric Celebrations from A (Aria) to Z (Zocalo). 1. The Scandinavian Julbord (Yule Table). SAN BERNARDINO – In recognition of his great aunt, San Bernardino Valley College art instructor David Rosales constructed an altar box that includes pictures of her as a young woman in Mexico, an old lithograph from his grandfather’s house and his own watercolor painting. The artwork, titled “Altar Box for Mrs. Martinez” is one of many on display at the Dia de los Muertos exhibit that opened this week in the Gresham Art Gallery at the college. “This is different artists’ interpretations of this celebration of life,” said Rosales, also the director of the art gallery.

( CNN ) — Portuguese sailors called it the `` Gates of Hell . '' Namibia 's Bushmen speak of it as the `` gates of the underworld.'' For more than a decade, the Portuguese-built port city of Oporto has remained a secret from outsiders — even its inhabitants. The city is home to one of the world's last indigenous cultures. While many Westerners live in cities far away, their descendants are drawn to this remote, mysterious community, where poverty is rampant. The Portuguese first settled the area in the 17th century and built a trade route across the Indian Ocean.

The Toronto real estate market is showing signs of stirring from its deep freeze , with new listings starting to emerge from all the hottest parts of the city. While inventory is still very thin in most markets, it is starting to thin across much of the GTA region and even in Vancouver. According to an article in the Toronto Globe and Mail, Toronto has seen new listings open on the first day of every month since Jan. 1, 2017 — and they’re coming in much faster than they have in some years, with the fastest month-on-month increase in listings opening in August 2017 and October 2016.

In recent years, platformers have proven to be a hospitable genre for video game developers looking to flaunt their artistry. It is why games like “Journey” and “Inside” can both be constructed around jumping avatars but otherwise appear quite distinct.

The Texas Supreme Court has transferred about 80 cases from El Paso 's 8th Court of Appeals in a first round of transfer of jurisdiction. This is the first time Texas has transferred cases from an appellate court from one of its three regions to another. El Paso County has a total of 11 appeals courts, including the court of appeals for each of its three counties. Previously, the court of appeals had jurisdiction for about 30 percent of a county’s cases. El Paso County's transfer of jurisdiction means a majority of its appeals courts will now be based in a new county.

It has seemed for a while as though the global financial storm was going to deal a mostly glancing blow to the entire global economy. For all its talk of a "Great Recession," it has been all but impossible to predict which countries will go into recession. This has been true for many years now. It is most likely that the global economy will remain in the black in the months and years to follow, as it did for a few years prior to 2008 and has been for nearly a decade now, but with an increasing number of countries in the process.

Millions of refugees have fled their homes in war-torn Syria since 2011 . President Barack Obama previously planned to resettle 10,000 over the next year. But following the massive terror attacks in Paris over the weekend where at least 129 died, many governors and legislators — mostly Republicans — have called for Obama to rethink the resettlement strategy. Delaware is one of at least nine states to openly welcome the idea of refugees, despite an avalanche of largely Republican governors opposing. (CNN) — Spending the night at an airport isn't usually an aspirational sleeping arrangement. That was before someone transformed the original flight control tower at Stockholm Arlanda Airport into a luxury apartment. The disused tower is now home to a spacious, bright space complete with panoramic views of the runways below. The airport control tower is now a chic, minimalistic apartment space. HARRISBURG , Pa. ( AP ) — Pennsylvania State Police say car accidents killed seven people and injured 315 others in the state’s largest county this month. That’s up from five killed in December 2018 and two in January 2019. Two people are still in a coma at hospitals after a tractor trailer and a truck collided. Officials said this was the largest crash involving tractor trailers in Pennsylvania since 2011 when more than 250 people were seriously injured when a tractor trailer and pickup truck collided on Interstate 81.

The best retirement financial advice you can get might be to get more sleep . That is the provocative implication of a report last month issued by research firm Roubini Global Financial Markets. The report, published by the International Monetary Fund, found that the number of employees in the labor force who were sleep deprived doubled from 10 percent of the population in 1990 to 22 percent by 2012. And that may be because of the aging of the country's population, the report warned. "When you reach a certain age your ability to work increases sharply," said Robert Brulle, the author of the report.

Teaching language to an artificial intelligence system is child’s play, thanks to MIT. Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology developed a parser that imitates kids’ learning processes by observing the environment and making connections. The system studies captioned videos and learns to associate words with objects and actions. When given a new sentence, the parser can accurately predict its meaning—without visual clues. This “weakly supervised” approach, which requires limited training input, could expand the types of data and reduce the effort needed for training parsers. Annotations can certainly speed up the process, but they’re not needed to learn.

The Volstead Act was repealed on this date in 1933, returning control of alcohol to the states, and it was a happy day at the F.X. Matt Brewery. UTICA, N.Y. -- A total of 85 years ago Wednesday marked the end of prohibition, which meant legally drinking beer again. And for the Matt family from Utica – that meant getting back to selling beer again. They let customers and suppliers know that at midnight, they could deliver, buy, and drink beer at the brewery once again. The local business managed to survive 13 years.

In the week between Christmas and New Years , Gov . George Pataki signed into law two bills sponsored by Reps. Ed Towns of New York, Raul Griego of Puerto Rico and Daniel Donovan of Michigan. The first law, the “Toxic Waste Act,” makes it illegal to dump household waste, yard waste and refuse into landfills or the ocean without proper permits. The bill is aimed at curbing what the Environmental Protection Agency has called a “dumping phenomenon” in which hazardous substances are allowed to accumulate in landfills for decades.

BOB Cole died yesterday. Around 2pm in a purpose-built flat on a Swiss industrial estate outside Zurich, he said goodbye to his friends, and went to sleep for the last time. He was 68, terminally ill, and was taking his life into his own hands, as around 30 Britons do each year at the Dignitas. His wife, Pam, was one of them. She was suffering from progressive supernuclear palsy, a fatal brain disease, and faced a terrible death. In February last year she died as Chris de Burgh’s Here is Your Paradise played at her bedside.

SAVANNAH , Ga. ( AP ) — A pair of Buckeyes were doing their best to hold off a team of Georgia players in their annual game Saturday. The U.S. women’s volleyball team was down 3-0 before the second set against the University of Georgia. They had won the first set by 13 points, and then they were held to a 3-0 halftime lead by the Bulldogs, who outscored the Buckeyes 22-7 in the second set. In the final game of the two-set contest, U.S. Coach Sue Grafton and the team came up with enough offense to get the edge over Georgia, 6-5.

McALLEN — School district trustees and top officials met with the local citizens league Thursday to cover the upcoming Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, which takes effect on Jan. 1, 2017, and which Gov. Scott Walker is scheduled to sign. During the event, the members of the Citizen's League made presentations on the topic of tax reform, the state budget, education funding, and Wisconsin's budget crisis. They were also asked about their opinion about the state legislature's recent attempts at compromise, and the effect those efforts had on local school budgets.

RIDESHARING SERVICES WHICH supporters claim could spare Irish cities from gridlock are being effectively locked out of the country on the grounds of breaking taxi laws. Transport officials have recently questioned one of the industry’s newest entrants, a carpooling app backed by entrepreneur and Dragon’s Den investor Sean O’Sullivan, on how it fits within rules that have already seen similar operators abandon the market. But Cork-based startup Carma Carpooling claims it is only promoting the kind of ridesharing setups neighbours and colleagues have been doing for decades.

Evo Morales, Bolivia's president-elect, fresh from meetings with the leaders of Cuba and Venezuela, says that his country welcomes foreign investors, but it will not relinquish control of its natural resources. "Bolivia needs partners, foreign investors, but not owners of our natural resources," Morales told reporters on Wednesday in Madrid where he was stopping as part of a continuing tour that includes visits to France, Belgium, South Africa, China and Brazil. "My government ... is going to exercise its property right over its natural resources."
